recipe_title: Seared Five-Spice Duck Breast with Snow Peas and Watercress
original_instructions:
To make the dressing, combine the rice vinegar, vegetable oil, soy sauce, sesame oil, grated ginger, sugar and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a small bowl and mix well. Set aside.
Combine the remaining salt and the five-spice powder and sprinkle the mixture over the duck. Place a nonstick frying pan over high heat until hot. Place the duck, skin side down, in the pan and cook until golden brown, about 3 minutes. Turn the breasts, reduce the heat and cook until medium-rare, 6 to 7 minutes. Remove the duck from the pan, place on a cutting board, and let rest for 5 minutes. Do not cover the duck or the skin will not be crisp.
In a large bowl, combine the watercress, snow peas and cabbage. Pour the dressing over the top and toss to coat. Divide the salad among 4 serving plates. Cut the duck into slices on the diagonal. Arrange the slices on each salad and serve.
ingredients: 12 ounces boneless duck breast, skin scored
1 bunch watercress (about 4 ounces), tough stems removed
step_by_step_instructions: Combine rice vinegar, vegetable oil, soy sauce, sesame oil, grated ginger, sugar, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a small bowl to make the dressing and mix well. Set aside.
Combine the remaining salt and five-spice powder and sprinkle over the duck.
Place a nonstick frying pan over high heat until hot. Place the duck, skin side down, in the pan and cook until golden brown, about 3 minutes.
Turn the duck breasts, reduce the heat, and cook until medium-rare, 6 to 7 minutes.
Remove the duck from the pan, place on a cutting board, and let rest for 5 minutes. Do not cover the duck.
In a large bowl, combine watercress, snow peas, and cabbage.
Pour the dressing over the top of the salad and toss to coat.
Divide the salad among 4 serving plates.
Cut the duck into slices on the diagonal.
Arrange the duck slices on each salad and serve.

original_instructions:
Beat together the evaporated milk and egg yolks in a medium bowl. Strain into a 3-quart pot and simmer over medium heat until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool. Transfer the egg yolk mixture to a blender, and blend in batches. Add the remaining ingredients, blending at high speed until frothy. Pour into a pitcher and refrigerate until chilled before serving.
Beat together the evaporated milk and egg yolks in a medium bowl. Strain into a 3-quart pot and simmer over medium heat until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool.
Transfer the egg yolk mixture to a blender, and blend in batches. Add the remaining ingredients, blending at high speed until frothy. Pour into a pitcher and refrigerate until chilled before serving.
step_by_step_instructions: Beat together the evaporated milk and egg yolks in a medium bowl.
Strain the mixture into a 3-quart pot.
Simmer over medium heat until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes.
Remove from the heat and let the mixture cool.
Transfer the egg yolk mixture to a blender.
Blend in batches until smooth.
Add the coconut milk, sweetened condensed milk, white rum, ground cinnamon, and salt.
Blend at high speed until frothy.
Pour the mixture into a pitcher.
Refrigerate until chilled before serving.

original_instructions:
Place beans, celery, red pepper, vinegar, and oil in a medium bowl. Toss until well combined. Adjust seasonings with salt and pepper. Add basil and serve immediately.
Morph: For a super quick white bean dip: puree the salad in a food processor or blender, add 1 or 2 dashes of hot sauce and serve on crackers or grilled bread.
ingredients: 1 (19-ounce) can cannellini beans, rinsed and drained (use any canned bean you like)
1/2 roasted red pepper, peeled, seeded, and chopped
step_by_step_instructions: Rinse and drain the cannellini beans.
Thinly slice the celery.
Peel, seed, and chop the roasted red pepper.
Place the beans, celery, and red pepper in a medium bowl.
Add the red wine vinegar and extra-virgin olive oil to the bowl.
Toss all the ingredients until well combined.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Hand tear the basil leaves and add them to the mixture.
Serve immediately.

recipe_title: Root Veggie Salad with Horseradish Dressing
original_instructions: In a salad bowl combine the horseradish, mustard, red wine vinegar and honey. In a slow steady steam add the extra-virgin olive oil and whisk to combine. Add the carrots, radishes, dill and parsley, toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper, toss again and serve.
ingredients: 1/2 cup chopped flat-leaf parsley, 2 generous handfuls
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: In a salad bowl combine the horseradish, mustard, red wine vinegar, and honey.
In a slow steady stream add the extra-virgin olive oil and whisk to combine.
Add the carrots, radishes, dill, and parsley, toss to coat.
Season with salt and pepper, toss again and serve.

recipe_title: Boston Lettuce Avocado Salad and Lime Dressing
original_instructions:
Pull the lettuce leaves from the head, rinse gently under cold water, and lay out on clean towels to dry. Use a spoon to remove the flesh in 1 piece from each half of the avocado. Thinly slice the avocado flesh into thin wedges.
Whisk together all the dressing ingredients.
Arrange the lettuce leaves on a plate and top with the avocado wedges, scallion, and cilantro. Finish with a healthy drizzling of the dressing.
ingredients: 2 small to medium heads Boston lettuce, discard any wilted leaves
Leaves from 1 bunch cilantro, finely chopped
step_by_step_instructions: Pull the lettuce leaves from the head.
Rinse the lettuce leaves gently under cold water.
Lay out the lettuce leaves on clean towels to dry.
Use a spoon to remove the flesh from each half of the avocado.
Thinly slice the avocado flesh into thin wedges.
Whisk together lime juice, olive oil, salt, sugar, black pepper, and mustard to make the dressing.
Arrange the lettuce leaves on a plate.
Top the lettuce leaves with avocado wedges, scallions, and cilantro.
Finish with a drizzling of the dressing over the salad.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.
Put the cake mix in a mixing bowl and add the butter. Using a pastry blender or 2 forks, cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add the eggs, milk and rum. Beat with a wooden spoon until you form a smooth batter. Fold in coconut until evenly distributed.
Spray 2 madeleine molds with nonstick cooking spray. Using a tablespoon, drop the batter into the molds filling halfway. If you don't have madeleine molds, you may drop the batter on an ungreased baking pan. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes, until the cookies are nicely browned. Let cool in the pan then turn out onto a platter. Repeat method with remaining batter.
ingredients: 1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, cut into chunks
2 tablespoons dark rum or rum extract
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.
Put the cake mix in a mixing bowl and add the butter.
Using a pastry blender or 2 forks, cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Add the eggs, milk and rum.
Beat with a wooden spoon until you form a smooth batter.
Fold in coconut until evenly distributed.
Spray 2 madeleine molds with nonstick cooking spray.
Using a tablespoon, drop the batter into the molds filling halfway.
Bake for 12 to 15 minutes, until the cookies are nicely browned.
Let cool in the pan then turn out onto a platter.
Repeat method with remaining batter.

original_instructions:
Mix first 4 ingredients. Form mixture into four 1-inch-thick patties. Broil 5 to 7 minutes on each side for medium to well-done burgers. Top each burger with a cheese slice right before removing from the oven. Transfer burgers onto buns, top with lettuce and tomato and serve.
Mix first 4 ingredients. Form mixture into four 1-inch-thick patties. Broil 5 to 7 minutes on each side for medium to well-done burgers. Top each burger with a cheese slice right before removing from the oven. Transfer burgers onto buns, top with lettuce and tomato and serve.
step_by_step_instructions: Mix ground beef, chopped onion, chili sauce, and Dijon mustard together.
Form the mixture into four 1-inch-thick patties.
Broil patties for 5 to 7 minutes on each side for medium to well-done burgers.
Top each burger with a slice of cheese right before removing them from the oven.
Transfer burgers onto hamburger buns.
Top with lettuce and tomato slices and serve.

original_instructions:
Make the dressing: Whisk the vinegar, mustard, sugar, 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper in a large bowl. Gradually whisk in the olive oil until well blended.
Add the cabbage, parsley, scallions and grapes to the bowl and toss to coat with the dressing. Cover and refrigerate 1 to 4 hours before serving.
Photograph by Yunhee Kim
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
1 small or 1/2 large head red cabbage, finely shredded
step_by_step_instructions: Whisk the vinegar, mustard, sugar, 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper in a large bowl.
Gradually whisk in the olive oil until well blended.
Add the cabbage, parsley, scallions and grapes to the bowl.
Toss to coat with the dressing.
Cover and refrigerate 1 to 4 hours before serving.

original_instructions:
Cut the top third off each lemon. Cut a small slice off the bottom of each lemon so it stands up. Using a spoon, carefully scoop out the inside of each lemon, creating a lemon cup. Put the lemon cup in the freezer for at least 1 hour.
Put the sorbet into the bowl of a food processor. Add the limoncello and vodka and process until smooth. Place the frozen lemon cups onto shot glasses filled with limoncello. Fill the lemon shells with the sorbet mixture and serve.
ingredients: 4 ounces limoncello or other lemon-flavored liqueur, chilled, plus 4 shots for serving
step_by_step_instructions: Cut the top third off each lemon.
Cut a small slice off the bottom of each lemon so it stands up.
Using a spoon, carefully scoop out the inside of each lemon, creating a lemon cup.
Put the lemon cup in the freezer for at least 1 hour.
Put the sorbet into the bowl of a food processor.
Add the limoncello and vodka to the sorbet.
Process until smooth.
Place the frozen lemon cups onto shot glasses filled with limoncello.
Fill the lemon shells with the sorbet mixture.
Serve.

original_instructions:
Whisk together oil, sour cream, vinegar, water, anchovy paste, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Add cabbage and parsley and toss until coated.
Whisk together oil, sour cream, vinegar, water, anchovy paste, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Add cabbage and parsley and toss until coated.
ingredients: 1/2 Savoy or green cabbage, cored, cut into 3 wedges, and thinly sliced crosswise (6 to 8 cups)
step_by_step_instructions: Whisk together oil, sour cream, vinegar, water, anchovy paste, salt, and pepper in a large bowl.
Add cabbage and parsley to the bowl and toss until coated.

recipe_title: Iceberg and Watercress Salad with Blue Cheese Dressing
original_instructions:
Whisk together mayonnaise, sour cream, cheese, lemon juice, chives, salt, and pepper in a small bowl and thin with milk or water to desired consistency.
Toss iceberg, watercress, and celery in a large bowl and drizzle with dressing.
ingredients: 2 bunches watercress, coarse stems discarded (6 cups)
step_by_step_instructions: Whisk together mayonnaise, sour cream, cheese, lemon juice, chives, salt, and pepper in a small bowl.
Thin the mixture with milk or water to the desired consistency.
Toss iceberg lettuce, watercress, and celery in a large bowl.
Drizzle the tossed lettuce, watercress, and celery with dressing.

original_instructions: In a blender, add the ice cream, milk, marshmallow cream and white chocolate liqueur and blend until smooth. If you do not add the liqueur replace it with milk. Serve in tall glasses.
ingredients: 1/2 cup cold milk (increase to 1 cup if omitting liqueur)
step_by_step_instructions: In a blender, add the ice cream, milk, marshmallow cream, and white chocolate liqueur.
Blend the mixture until smooth.
Serve the blended mixture in tall glasses.

original_instructions: Reserve 4 raspberries and cut off 4 slices of lemon for the garnish. Mash the raspberries and sugar in a small bowl and let sit at room temperature to thaw and bring out their juices, about 15 minutes. Set a sieve over a pitcher and juice the lemons. Rinse the sieve and add the raspberries. Push the raspberry mixture through the sieve with a rubber spatula, leaving the seeds in the sieve. Pour 1 quart of cold water through the sieve to get remove the remaining juices. Stir the lemonade and check for sweetness. Serve in ice-filled glasses and garnish with raspberry and a lemon slice. For the adults, add 1 1/2 ounces vodka to each glass.
ingredients: 6 ounces raspberry or citrus vodka, divided, optional
step_by_step_instructions: Reserve 4 raspberries and cut off 4 slices of lemon for the garnish.
Mash the raspberries and sugar in a small bowl and let sit at room temperature to thaw and bring out their juices, about 15 minutes.
Set a sieve over a pitcher and juice the lemons.
Rinse the sieve and add the raspberries.
Push the raspberry mixture through the sieve with a rubber spatula, leaving the seeds in the sieve.
Pour 1 quart of cold water through the sieve to get remove the remaining juices.
Stir the lemonade and check for sweetness.
Serve in ice-filled glasses and garnish with raspberry and a lemon slice.
For the adults, add 1 1/2 ounces vodka to each glass.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Prepare the leg of lamb by rubbing salt, pepper, and chopped garlic all over the outside of the meat, then rub with the olive oil to coat. Put the lamb in a large baking pan, cover it with 4 orange slices, 4 lemon slices, and the rosemary. Bake for 2 hours. Serve the lamb sliced on a plate with the dressing on top.
1 orange, zested
1 lemon, zested
1 cup olive oil
1 cup fresh squeezed orange juice
1/2 cup fresh squeezed lemon juice
1/2 cup red wine vinegar
2 cloves garlic
2 tablespoons chopped fresh oregano leaves
2 tablespoons salt
1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
Put all the ingredients into a blender. Blend until the dressing is completely uniform and creamy.
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Rub salt, pepper, and chopped garlic all over the outside of the leg of lamb.
Rub the leg of lamb with olive oil to coat.
Place the lamb in a large baking pan.
Cover the lamb with 4 slices of orange, 4 slices of lemon, and fresh rosemary.
Bake the lamb in the oven for 2 hours.
In the meantime, zest the orange and lemon.

In a blender, combine orange zest, lemon zest, 1 cup of olive oil, fresh squeezed orange juice, fresh squeezed lemon juice, red wine vinegar, garlic, chopped oregano leaves, salt, and freshly ground black pepper.
Blend the ingredients until the dressing is completely uniform and creamy.
Slice the lamb after baking and serve on a plate with the dressing on top.

original_instructions:
Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a wok or a large frying pan. Add the garlic and ginger, and saute until golden brown. Add the shrimp and cook for 1 to 2 minutes until pink, tossing from time to time. Remove and set aside in a bowl.
Heat 1/2 tablespoon of oil in the same pan and add the eggs. Stir to scramble the egg into small pieces, remove and set aside with the shrimp.
Heat the remaining oil in the pan and add the soy sauce, fish sauce, rice wine, red pepper flakes, and brown sugar. Stir briefly, add the drained noodles, and cook for 5 minutes.
Add the bean sprouts, chopped scallions, and cilantro. Mix well and continue to cook until noodles are heated through. Season, if necessary, with a little more soy sauce or fish sauce, sprinkle in lime zest and juice, and serve while hot!
ingredients: 7 ounces rice noodles, soaked in warm water for 10 to 15 minutes then drained
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a wok or a large frying pan.
Add the garlic and ginger, and sauté until golden brown.
Add the shrimp and cook for 1 to 2 minutes until pink, tossing from time to time.
Remove the shrimp and set aside in a bowl.
Heat 1/2 tablespoon of vegetable oil in the same pan and add the eggs.
Stir to scramble the egg into small pieces, remove and set aside with the shrimp.
Heat the remaining vegetable oil in the pan and add the soy sauce, fish sauce, rice wine vinegar, red pepper flakes, and brown sugar.
Stir briefly, add the drained noodles, and cook for 5 minutes.
Add the bean sprouts, chopped scallions, and cilantro.
Mix well and continue to cook until noodles are heated through.
Season, if necessary, with a little more soy sauce or fish sauce, sprinkle in lime zest and juice, and serve while hot.

original_instructions:
Peel strings from celery with a Y-shaped vegetable peeler and cut celery into 1/4-inch-thick matchsticks.
Whisk together juice, vinegar, and ginger and stir in celery and remaining ingredients with salt and pepper, to taste. Let stand at room temperature 15 minutes before serving.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon finely grated peeled fresh ginger
2 firm Asian pears, cut into 1/4-inch-thick matchsticks
1/2 teaspoon finely chopped fresh hot red chile, or to taste
step_by_step_instructions: Peel strings from celery with a Y-shaped vegetable peeler.
Cut celery into 1/4-inch-thick matchsticks.
Whisk together juice, vinegar, and ginger.
Stir in celery, pears, scallions, cilantro, and chile.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Let stand at room temperature for 15 minutes before serving.

recipe_title: Pepper Jack, Avocado and Black Beans in a Tortilla
original_instructions:
1. Place shredded cheese, beans and avocado onto 1 tortilla. 2. Place 2nd tortilla on top. 3. Close the sandwich. 4. Spread evenly 1/2 teaspoon of lightly salted butter onto each side of the tortilla. 5. Grill over moderate heat for approximately 3-4 minutes per side. 6. Garnish with sour cream and salsa.
1. Place shredded cheese, beans and avocado onto 1 tortilla.
2. Place 2nd tortilla on top.
3. Close the sandwich.
4. Spread evenly 1/2 teaspoon of lightly salted butter onto each side of the tortilla.
5. Grill over moderate heat for approximately 3-4 minutes per side.
6. Garnish with sour cream and salsa.
ingredients: 4 ounces shredded pepper jack cheese (1 cup)
step_by_step_instructions: Place shredded cheese, beans and avocado onto 1 tortilla.
Place 2nd tortilla on top.
Close the sandwich.
Spread evenly 1/2 teaspoon of lightly salted butter onto each side of the tortilla.
Grill over moderate heat for approximately 3-4 minutes per side.
Garnish with sour cream and salsa.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. Prepare a 10-inch cast iron skillet by heating it in the oven for 5 minutes. Remove the pan from the oven, add the butter, let it melt and set aside.
Put the eggs and corn in the bowl of a food processor and pulse until the corn is slightly smooth. Add the cornmeal, flour, sour cream, sugar, baking powder and salt and pulse until smooth. Transfer the mixture to a bowl and fold in the jalapeno and melted butter.
Pour the batter into the skillet and bake until golden brown and a skewer inserted in the center comes out clean, about 20 minutes. Serve warm or room temperature.
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.
Prepare a 10-inch cast iron skillet by heating it in the oven for 5 minutes.
Remove the pan from the oven and add the butter, letting it melt.
Set the melted butter aside.
Place the eggs and corn in the bowl of a food processor and pulse until the corn is slightly smooth.
Add the cornmeal, flour, sour cream, sugar, baking powder, and salt to the processor and pulse until smooth.
Transfer the mixture to a bowl.
Fold in the chopped jalapeno and melted butter.
Pour the batter into the skillet.
Bake until golden brown and a skewer inserted in the center comes out clean, about 20 minutes.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

original_instructions: In a steamer, set over boiling water, steam the carrots, covered, for 4 to 8 minutes, or until they are just tender. In a small skillet melt the butter with the honey over moderately low heat, add the carrots and salt and pepper to taste, and cook the carrots, tossing them, for 1 minute, or until they are well-coated with the glaze.;
ingredients: 1 pound baby carrots, trimmed and peeled
step_by_step_instructions: Set a steamer over boiling water.
Steam the carrots, covered, for 4 to 8 minutes until just tender.
In a small skillet, melt the butter with the honey over moderately low heat.
Add the steamed carrots to the skillet.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
Cook the carrots, tossing them, for 1 minute until they are well-coated with the glaze.

original_instructions:
Mix the flour, eggs and a pinch of salt in a bowl, then gradually stir in up to 1 cup water to make a smooth, batter-like dough. Beat with a wooden spoon until bubbles form, then stir in the melted butter.
Bring a large saucepan of salted water to a boil. Place about 1 cup of the dough in a colander with large holes; use a rubber spatula to push the dough through the holes and into the boiling water. (Or use a spaetzle press.) Cook for about 1 minute after the spaetzle float to the surface, then transfer with a slotted spoon to another colander. Repeat with the remaining dough. Rinse the spaetzle in cold water if not serving immediately and set aside.
Before serving, saute the spaetzle in a skillet with the remaining 2 tablespoons butter until warmed through. Season with pepper and garnish with parsley.
Photograph by Kate Mathis
step_by_step_instructions: Mix the flour, eggs, and a pinch of salt in a bowl.
Gradually stir in up to 1 cup water to make a smooth, batter-like dough.
Beat with a wooden spoon until bubbles form.
Stir in the melted butter.
Bring a large saucepan of salted water to a boil.
Place about 1 cup of the dough in a colander with large holes.
Use a rubber spatula to push the dough through the holes and into the boiling water, or use a spaetzle press.
Cook for about 1 minute after the spaetzle float to the surface.
Transfer the spaetzle with a slotted spoon to another colander.
Repeat with the remaining dough.
Rinse the spaetzle in cold water if not serving immediately and set aside.
Before serving, sauté the spaetzle in a skillet with the remaining butter until warmed through.
Season with pepper.
Garnish with parsley before serving.

original_instructions:
Trim ends of the broccoli rabe and cut into 3-inch pieces.
Bring 2 inches water to a boil in a high sided skillet. Salt the water. Add the broccoli rabe and simmer 10 minutes, drain. Return skillet to the stove and heat extra-virgin olive oil over medium-high heat. Add sausage, brown and crumble 6 to 7 minutes. Add the broccoli rabe and stir to combine.
ingredients: 1 large bundle broccoli rabe, about 1 1/4 to 1 1/2 pounds
1 pound bulk Italian hot or sweet sausage
step_by_step_instructions: Trim ends of the broccoli rabe and cut into 3-inch pieces.
Bring 2 inches of water to a boil in a high-sided skillet.
Salt the water.
Add the broccoli rabe and simmer for 10 minutes, then drain.
Return skillet to the stove and heat extra-virgin olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add sausage, brown and crumble for 6 to 7 minutes.
Add the broccoli rabe and stir to combine.

original_instructions:
Thread the carrots, cucumber, lettuce and tomatoes onto 4 long wooden skewers, alternating the vegetables. Refrigerate; serve with the dressing.
Photograph by Levi Brown
ingredients: 1/2 head iceberg lettuce, cut into 2 1/2-inch chunks
step_by_step_instructions: Thread the carrots onto the wooden skewers.
Thread the cucumber onto the wooden skewers.
Thread the lettuce onto the wooden skewers.
Thread the tomatoes onto the wooden skewers.
Alternate the vegetables while threading onto the skewers.
Refrigerate the skewers.
Serve with dressing.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Combine first 5 ingredients in large bowl. Transfer to 13x9x2-inch glass baking dish. Bake until top is slightly golden, about 1 hour 10 minutes. Sprinkle with onions. Bake until golden brown, about 5 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350°F. Combine first 5 ingredients in large bowl. Transfer to 13x9x2-inch glass baking dish. Bake until top is slightly golden, about 1 hour 10 minutes. Sprinkle with onions. Bake until golden brown, about 5 minutes.
ingredients: 1 2-pound package frozen hash brown potatoes, unthawed
1 10 3/4-ounce can cream of celery soup, undiluted
3 cups (packed) grated sharp cheddar cheese (about 12 ounces)
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Combine first 5 ingredients in large bowl.
Transfer to 13x9x2-inch glass baking dish.
Bake until top is slightly golden, about 1 hour 10 minutes.
Sprinkle with onions.
Bake until golden brown, about 5 minutes.

original_instructions:
In a small bowl, stir together mayonnaise, creme fraiche, cornichons, parsley, lemon juice, capers, mustard, tarragon, and salt and pepper, to taste until combined well.
In a large saucepan of salted boiling water, cook celery root 2 minutes. Drain celery root in a sieve and refresh under cold water. Dry celery root completely. Add celery root to sauce and stir together. Chill salad until ready to serve.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons creme fraiche or sour cream
2 cornichons (sour gherkins), minced, or 1 tablespoon minced dill pickle
2 small celery roots (about 1 1/4 pound total), peeled and cut into matchstick pieces or shredded coarse
step_by_step_instructions: In a small bowl, stir together mayonnaise, creme fraiche, cornichons, parsley, lemon juice, capers, mustard, tarragon, and salt and pepper, to taste until combined well.
In a large saucepan of salted boiling water, cook celery root for 2 minutes.
Drain celery root in a sieve and refresh under cold water.
Dry celery root completely.
Add celery root to sauce and stir together.
Chill salad until ready to serve.

original_instructions: Clean and slice potatoes into bite sized rounds and boil until fork tender. Squeeze out the pulp from the head of garlic. Make vinaigrette by whisking garlic, mustard and vinegar in a bowl and then slowly whisking in olive oil, season with salt and pepper and add mustard seeds at the end. While potatoes are still warm and drained, toss with vinaigrette. Just before serving add onions, herbs and watercress.
ingredients: 2 pounds fingerling potatoes (you can also use red bliss or other heirloom potatoes)
1 tablespoon roasted garlic (1 head rubbed with olive oil then baked at 350 degrees for 45 minutes)
1/3 cup fresh chopped herbs (parsley, tarragon, and thyme)
step_by_step_instructions: Clean and slice potatoes into bite sized rounds.
Boil potatoes until fork tender.
Squeeze out the pulp from the head of garlic.
Make vinaigrette by whisking garlic, mustard and vinegar in a bowl.
Slowly whisk in olive oil into the mixture.
Season the vinaigrette with salt and pepper.
Add mustard seeds to the vinaigrette.
While potatoes are still warm and drained, toss them with the vinaigrette.
Just before serving, add onions, herbs, and watercress to the potatoes.

original_instructions: Combine cucumber, cabbage, and onion in a bowl. Bring the rice vinegar, sugar, 1/2 cup water and salt, to taste, to a boil in saucepan, stirring, and immediately pour over cucumber mixture. Toss mixture and let stand at room temperature, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes. To cool quickly, chill in freezer 15 minutes.;
ingredients: 2/3 English cucumber, halved lengthwise and thinly sliced crosswise
1/2 small red cabbage, very thinly sliced
step_by_step_instructions: Combine the cucumber, cabbage, and onion in a bowl.
Bring the rice vinegar, sugar, 1/2 cup water, and salt to a boil in a saucepan, stirring continuously.
Immediately pour the boiling mixture over the cucumber mixture.
Toss the mixture and let it stand at room temperature, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes.
To cool quickly, place it in the freezer for 15 minutes.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Place 16 paper liners in muffin pans.
In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy, about 5 minutes. With the mixer on low speed, add the eggs 1 at a time, then add the vanilla, sour cream, and milk. In a separate bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. With the mixer on low speed add the flour mixture to the batter and beat until just mixed. Fold in the blueberries with a spatula and be sure the batter is completely mixed.
Scoop the batter into the prepared muffin pans, filling each cup just over the top, and bake for 25 to 30 minutes, until the muffins are lightly browned on top and a cake tester comes out clean.
ingredients: 12 tablespoons (1 1/2 sticks) unsalted butter, at room temperature
2 half-pints fresh blueberries, picked through for stems
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Place 16 paper liners in muffin pans.
In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy, about 5 minutes.
With the mixer on low speed, add the eggs 1 at a time, then add the vanilla, sour cream, and milk.
In a separate bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
With the mixer on low speed add the flour mixture to the batter and beat until just mixed.
Fold in the blueberries with a spatula and be sure the batter is completely mixed.
Scoop the batter into the prepared muffin pans, filling each cup just over the top.
Bake for 25 to 30 minutes, until the muffins are lightly browned on top and a cake tester comes out clean.

original_instructions:
Bring water to a boil with salt in a 4-quart heavy pot, then add polenta in a thin stream, whisking. Cook over moderate heat, whisking, 2 minutes. Reduce heat to low and simmer polenta, covered, stirring for 1 minute after every 10 minutes of cooking, 45 minutes total. Remove from heat and serve warm.
Bring water to a boil with salt in a 4-quart heavy pot, then add polenta in a thin stream, whisking. Cook over moderate heat, whisking, 2 minutes. Reduce heat to low and simmer polenta, covered, stirring for 1 minute after every 10 minutes of cooking, 45 minutes total. Remove from heat and serve warm.
ingredients: 2 cups polenta (not quick-cooking) or yellow cornmeal (10 ounces)
step_by_step_instructions: Bring 8 cups of water to a boil in a 4-quart heavy pot and add 2 teaspoons of salt.
Add 2 cups of polenta in a thin stream while whisking continuously.
Cook over moderate heat, whisking for 2 minutes.
Reduce heat to low and cover the pot.
Simmer the polenta for a total of 45 minutes, stirring for 1 minute after every 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and serve warm.

original_instructions:
Spread the mango chutney over the tortilla and sprinkle with the Mediterranean spice blend. Top with turkey, spinach and cheese.
Roll-up and serve immediately or wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to serve.
ingredients: 4 slices Hillshire Farm(R) Lower Sodium Oven Roasted Turkey
1 slice Manchego cheese (can be substituted with fat-free feta)
step_by_step_instructions: Spread the mango chutney over the tortilla.
Sprinkle with the Mediterranean spice blend.
Top with turkey.
Add spinach on top of the turkey.
Place the cheese slice over the spinach.
Roll up the tortilla.
Serve immediately or wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to serve.

recipe_title: Oven Roasted Cinnamon Sweet Potato Fries
original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Place a heavy duty sheet tray into the oven to heat.
Add the sweet potatoes to a large bowl and drizzle with the olive oil. Season with the cinnamon, cumin, salt and pepper.
Spread out on the hot sheet tray and bake until crisp, 25 to 30 minutes. Flip the fries halfway through roasting.
ingredients: 2 large (about 1 1/2 pounds) sweet potatoes, peeled & cut into thin fries
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Place a heavy duty sheet tray into the oven to heat.
Add the sweet potatoes to a large bowl.
Drizzle the sweet potatoes with olive oil.
Season the sweet potatoes with cinnamon, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Spread the sweet potatoes out onto the hot sheet tray.
Bake in the oven until crisp, approximately 25 to 30 minutes.
Flip the fries halfway through roasting.

recipe_title: Babcock Peach or Braeburn Apple Pancake Tatins
original_instructions:
Preheat the broiler.
Place the first 4 ingredients in a medium mixing bowl and toss together. Let stand for at least 30 minutes.
Drain the excess liquid from the fruit mixture and reserve. Melt half of the unsalted and clarified butters in a medium non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Add half of the fruit mixture and brown for 3 minutes.
Pour half of the pancake batter over the fruit starting from the center of the pan. Let batter set for about 3 minutes, and then place under the broiler for about 3 to 4 minutes, or until lightly browned. Watch carefully the whole time, as it may brown more quickly. Remove from the oven. Place a large enough plate to cover the pan over the pan and invert onto the plate. Repeat with the second half of the fruit and batter.
Garnish with powdered sugar and serve.
ingredients: 4 Babcock peaches or Braeburn apples, peeled and sliced
1/4 cup vanilla sugar or regular sugar
2 cups Gingerbread Pancake batter, or your favorite pancake batter
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the broiler.
Place the peaches, brown sugar, sugar, and vanilla extract in a medium mixing bowl and toss together.
Let stand for at least 30 minutes.
Drain the excess liquid from the fruit mixture and reserve.
Melt half of the unsalted and clarified butters in a medium non-stick pan over medium-high heat.
Add half of the fruit mixture and brown for 3 minutes.
Pour half of the pancake batter over the fruit starting from the center of the pan.
Let batter set for about 3 minutes.
Place under the broiler for about 3 to 4 minutes, or until lightly browned. Watch carefully the whole time.
Remove from the oven.
Place a large enough plate to cover the pan over the pan and invert onto the plate.
Repeat with the second half of the fruit and batter.
Garnish with powdered sugar and serve.

recipe_title: Rib-Eye Marinated in Garlic, Anaheim Chiles and Fresh Oregano
original_instructions:
Stir together the garlic, chiles, oregano and oil in a large baking dish. Add the steaks and turn to coat in the marinade. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours and up to 8 hours.
Heat grill to high. Remove the steaks from the refrigerator 30 minutes before grilling to take the chill off. Remove from the marinade and season liberally on both sides with salt and pepper. Grill the steaks on both sides until golden brown and slightly charred and cooked to medium-rare and an instant-read thermometer registers 130 degrees F. Remove from the grill to a cutting board and let rest, loosely tented with foil, for 10 minutes. Slice into 1/2-inch thick slices and serve.
ingredients: 3 Anaheim chiles, stems removed, sliced with seed and coarsely chopped
Salt and coarsely ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Stir together the garlic, chiles, oregano, and oil in a large baking dish.
Add the steaks and turn to coat in the marinade.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours and up to 8 hours.
Heat grill to high.
Remove the steaks from the refrigerator 30 minutes before grilling.
Remove steaks from the marinade, season with salt and pepper.
Grill the steaks on both sides until golden brown and slightly charred, to medium-rare.
Use an instant-read thermometer to check for 130 degrees F.
Let steaks rest, tented with foil, for 10 minutes.
Slice into 1/2-inch thick slices and serve.

original_instructions: Place the chopped chocolate into a large bowl. In a heavy saucepan heat the heavy cream until it just begins to simmer. Pour the cream over the chocolate. Stir until all of the chocolate has melted. The ganache is ready to pour.
step_by_step_instructions: Place the chopped chocolate into a large bowl.
In a heavy saucepan, heat the heavy cream until it just begins to simmer.
Pour the cream over the chocolate.
Stir until all of the chocolate has melted.
The ganache is ready to pour.

recipe_title: Grilled Rib Eye with Tomato and Arugula Salad
original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Heat a gas grill to medium-high heat on one side and medium heat on the other.
Generously season the steak with salt and pepper. Use a clean tea towel to brush the grill grates with oil.
Grill the steak on each side for 5 to 6 minutes for medium. Remove from the grill and allow to rest for 5 minutes. While the steak rests, prepare the salad.
In a separate bowl, add the vinegar and drizzle in the olive oil while whisking and season with salt and pepper. Add the arugula and tomatoes and toss to coat. Divide and arrange the salad between two plates. Slice the steak and divide between the two plates.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for grill grates
step_by_step_instructions: Heat a gas grill to medium-high heat on one side and medium heat on the other.
Generously season the steak with salt and pepper.
Use a clean tea towel to brush the grill grates with oil.
Grill the steak on each side for 5 to 6 minutes for medium.
Remove from the grill and allow to rest for 5 minutes.
In a separate bowl, add the vinegar and drizzle in the olive oil while whisking and season with salt and pepper.
Add the arugula and tomatoes to the bowl and toss to coat.
Divide and arrange the salad between two plates.
Slice the steak and divide between the two plates.

original_instructions:
Heat the butter and 1 tablespoon olive oil in a soup pot over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, and thyme and cook until the vegetables are good and soft, 8 to 10 minutes. Dust the vegetables with flour and stir to coat everything well. Pour in the vegetable stock and bring to a boil. Add the cream and the potatoes, bring to a boil and boil hard for about 7 minutes, until the potatoes break down (this will help to thicken the soup and give it a good texture).
Cut the corn kernels off the cob and add to the soup. Season with salt and pepper and simmer until the corn is soft, about 10 to 12 minutes. Stir in the parsley and give it another little drink of olive oil. Ladle the soup into bowls and serve.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Heat the butter and 1 tablespoon olive oil in a soup pot over medium heat.
Add the onion, garlic, and thyme to the pot and cook until the vegetables are soft, about 8 to 10 minutes.
Dust the vegetables with flour and stir to coat everything well.
Pour in the vegetable stock and bring to a boil.
Add the cream and potatoes to the pot, bring to a boil, and boil hard for about 7 minutes until the potatoes break down.
Cut the corn kernels off the cob and add to the soup.
Season the soup with salt and pepper.
Simmer until the corn is soft, about 10 to 12 minutes.
Stir in the parsley and add a little more olive oil.
Ladle the soup into bowls and serve.

recipe_title: Chocolate Shell Sauce for Ice Cream
original_instructions: Heat the coconut oil and chocolate over a double boiler of simmering water, stirring until melted. Turn off the heat and let cool for 5 minutes. Divide the ice cream among 3 bowls. Pour over the sauce; it will harden immediately.
ingredients: 8 ounces dark, milk or bittersweet chocolate, broken into pieces
step_by_step_instructions: Heat the coconut oil and chocolate over a double boiler of simmering water, stirring until melted.
Turn off the heat and let cool for 5 minutes.
Divide the ice cream among 3 bowls.
Pour over the sauce; it will harden immediately.

recipe_title: Fresh Smoked Salmon Tartar with Raspberries
original_instructions:
Special equipment: 4 sheets of cello paper
Half freeze the fresh salmon, so it can be cut easily. Cut thinly the fresh salmon in very small cubes, add salt, pepper, then the chopped shallot, the chive and the mayonnaise. Mix together.
Put 4 sheets of cello paper on your table, put on top the slices of smoked salmon, and then the fresh salmon tartar. Then you close the plastic wrap and you twist it to make a little balluchon. Then you take away the plastic wrap. To make the sauce: Crush the raspberries with the salt, the pepper and the hot sauce, add the vinegar and mix thoroughly. Add the olive oil and the cream. Place a cucumber rose on a plate, and place the balluchon on top. Make the balluchon shiny by pouring a little bit of olive oil on it. Put the sauce all around it and decorate with fresh raspberries and caviar.
ingredients: Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 cucumber, thinly sliced and formed into roses
step_by_step_instructions: Half freeze the fresh salmon for better slicing.
Cut the fresh salmon into very small cubes.
Season the salmon cubes with salt and pepper.
Add the chopped shallot, chives, and mayonnaise to the salmon and mix together.
Lay 4 sheets of cello paper on the table.
Place slices of smoked salmon on the cello paper.
Add the fresh salmon tartar on top of the smoked salmon slices.
Wrap the cello paper around the salmon to form a balluchon and twist it to secure.
Remove the plastic wrap from the balluchon.
To make the sauce, crush the raspberries with salt, pepper and hot sauce, then add raspberry vinegar and mix.
Add olive oil and cream to the raspberry mixture and blend thoroughly.
Create a cucumber rose and place it on a plate.
Place the balluchon on top of the cucumber rose.
Make the balluchon shiny by pouring a little olive oil on it.
Pour the sauce around the balluchon and decorate with fresh raspberries and caviar.

original_instructions:
Blend first 4 ingredients in food processor until cilantro is finely chopped, about 15 seconds. Transfer mixture to medium heatproof bowl. Heat oil in medium skillet over medium heat until hot; slowly whisk into cilantro mixture. Mix in hot sauce. Season sauce to taste with salt and pepper; transfer to small bowl. Serve with plantain chips. (Dip can be made 2 hours ahead. Let stand at room temperature.)
Blend first 4 ingredients in food processor until cilantro is finely chopped, about 15 seconds. Transfer mixture to medium heatproof bowl.
Heat oil in medium skillet over medium heat until hot; slowly whisk into cilantro mixture. Mix in hot sauce. Season sauce to taste with salt and pepper; transfer to small bowl. Serve with plantain chips. (Dip can be made 2 hours ahead. Let stand at room temperature.)
step_by_step_instructions: Blend cilantro, garlic, apple cider vinegar, and lime juice in a food processor until cilantro is finely chopped, about 15 seconds.
Transfer the mixture to a medium heatproof bowl.
Heat olive oil in a medium skillet over medium heat until hot.
Slowly whisk the hot oil into the cilantro mixture.
Mix in hot pepper sauce.
Season the sauce to taste with salt and pepper.
Transfer the sauce to a small bowl.
Serve the sauce with plantain chips.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
To make the meatballs: Stir the first 6 ingredients in a large bowl to blend. Stir in the cheese, beef and pork. Using 1 1/2 teaspoons for each, shape the meat mixture into 1-inch-diameter meatballs. Place on a baking sheet.
To make the soup: Bring the broth to a boil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the meatballs and curly endive and simmer until the meatballs are cooked through and the curly endive is tender, about 8 minutes. Whisk the eggs and cheese in a medium bowl to blend. Stir the soup in a circular motion. Gradually drizzle the egg mixture into the moving broth, stirring gently with a fork to form thin stands of egg, about 1 minute. Season the soup to taste with salt and pepper.
Ladle the soup into bowls and serve. Finish soup with parmesan cheese if desired.
ingredients: 1 slice fresh white bread, crust trimmed, bread torn into small pieces
1 pound curly endive, coarsely chopped (1 pound of escarole would be a good substitution)
2 tablespoon freshly grated Parmesan, plus extra for garnish
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Stir together the first 6 ingredients in a large bowl.
Add cheese, beef, and pork to the mixture, stirring to combine.
Shape mixture into 1-inch diameter meatballs using 1 1/2 teaspoons for each.
Place meatballs on a baking sheet.
Bring chicken broth to a boil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
Add the meatballs and curly endive to the broth and simmer for about 8 minutes.
Whisk eggs and cheese in a medium bowl to blend.
Stir the soup in a circular motion and gradually drizzle in the egg mixture, stirring gently with a fork for about 1 minute.
Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
Ladle the soup into bowls.
Garnish with additional parmesan cheese if desired.

original_instructions:
Combine marinade ingredients in the bottom of a shallow dish. Season meat of choice with salt and pepper and set meat into marinade and turn to coat. Allow meat to hangout 10 minutes.
Heat a nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Add marinated meat to the pan and cook 5 or 6 minutes on each side. Remove meat from the pan to a warm platter. Add butter to the skillet, chopped shallot or onion and mushroom bits (optional) then saute for 3 minutes over moderate heat. Add flour to the pan and cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Whisk in stock and reduce for another minute. Pour pan gravy over the meat and serve.
ingredients: 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
1 tablespoon chopped fresh thyme leaves, a few sprigs
1 tablespoon chopped parsley leaves, half a palm full
4 to 6 (1-inch) thick beef tournedos (filet steaks), 6 ounces each
4 pieces boneless skinless chicken breast, 6 to 8 ounces each
4 center cut pork loin chops, 8 ounces each, 1 inch thick
4 mushrooms, crimini or button, finely chopped, optional
1 cup beef, chicken or vegetable stock, found on soup aisle
step_by_step_instructions: Combine marinade ingredients in the bottom of a shallow dish.
Season meat of choice with salt and pepper.
Set meat into marinade and turn to coat.
Allow meat to hang out for 10 minutes.
Heat a nonstick skillet over medium high heat.
Add marinated meat to the pan and cook for 5 or 6 minutes on each side.
Remove meat from the pan to a warm platter.
Add butter to the skillet, chopped shallot or onion and mushrooms, then saute for 3 minutes over moderate heat.
Add flour to the pan and cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Whisk in stock and reduce for another minute.
Pour pan gravy over the meat and serve.

original_instructions:
Whisk together lemon juice, lemon zest, sugar, and eggs in a 2-quart saucepan. Cut butter into bits and add to mixture. Cook mixture, stirring constantly, over moderately low heat until curd is thick enough to hold marks of whisk and first bubble appears on surface, about 6 minutes. (You can make the curd 1 week ahead and chill it, covering its surface with plastic wrap.)
Whisk together lemon juice, lemon zest, sugar, and eggs in a 2-quart saucepan.
Cut butter into bits and add to mixture.
Cook mixture, stirring constantly, over moderately low heat until curd is thick enough to hold marks of whisk and first bubble appears on surface, about 6 minutes. (You can make the curd 1 week ahead and chill it, covering its surface with plastic wrap.)
ingredients: 1 tablespoon finely grated fresh lemon zest
step_by_step_instructions: Whisk together lemon juice, lemon zest, sugar, and eggs in a 2-quart saucepan.
Cut butter into bits and add to mixture.
Cook mixture, stirring constantly, over moderately low heat until curd is thick enough to hold marks of whisk and first bubble appears on surface, about 6 minutes.

original_instructions:
Cook fettuccine in a pasta pot of boiling salted water (2 tablespoons salt for 6 quarts water) until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup cooking water, then drain pasta. Meanwhile, bring cream and butter to a simmer in a 12-inch heavy skillet over medium-low heat, adding 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Add fettuccine, 1/4 cup reserved water, and cheese to sauce and toss. Add more cooking water if necessary.
Cook fettuccine in a pasta pot of boiling salted water (2 tablespoons salt for 6 quarts water) until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup cooking water, then drain pasta.
Meanwhile, bring cream and butter to a simmer in a 12-inch heavy skillet over medium-low heat, adding 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper.
Add fettuccine, 1/4 cup reserved water, and cheese to sauce and toss. Add more cooking water if necessary.
ingredients: 8 to 9 ounce egg fettuccine in nests
1/2 stick unsalted butter, cut into pieces
step_by_step_instructions: Cook fettuccine in a pasta pot of boiling salted water (2 tablespoons salt for 6 quarts water) until al dente.
Reserve 1/2 cup cooking water, then drain pasta.
Bring cream and butter to a simmer in a 12-inch heavy skillet over medium-low heat, adding salt and pepper.
Add fettuccine, 1/4 cup reserved water, and cheese to sauce and toss.
Add more cooking water if necessary to adjust the sauce consistency.

recipe_title: Quinoa Salad with Apricots, Basil and Pistachios
original_instructions:
Bring 2 cups water to a boil in a small saucepan over high heat. Stir in the quinoa. Cover, reduce the heat to low and cook until the liquid is just absorbed and the quinoa is moist and nearly tender, about 15 minutes.
Transfer the quinoa to a large bowl and immediately stir in the oil, apricots, 1 1/4 teaspoons salt and 3/4 teaspoon pepper. Set aside to cool slightly, about 20 minutes, stirring a couple times. Refrigerate until chilled, at least 2 hours.
When the quinoa is cool and ready to serve, stir in the arugula, basil, lemon juice and pistachios. Add salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with the goat cheese and serve.
ingredients: 12 dried apricots, finely diced, or 1/2 cup packed golden seedless raisins
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Bring 2 cups of water to a boil in a small saucepan over high heat.
Stir in the quinoa.
Cover the saucepan, reduce the heat to low and cook until the liquid is just absorbed and the quinoa is moist and nearly tender, about 15 minutes.
Transfer the quinoa to a large bowl.
Immediately stir in the oil, apricots, 1 1/4 teaspoons salt, and 3/4 teaspoon pepper.
Set aside to cool slightly, about 20 minutes, stirring a couple times.
Refrigerate the quinoa until chilled, at least 2 hours.
When ready to serve, stir in the arugula, basil, lemon juice, and pistachios.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
Sprinkle with the goat cheese and serve.

original_instructions:
In a large pitcher stir together well the champagne, the cranberry juice cocktail and the Grand Marnier.
In a large pitcher stir together well the champagne, the cranberry juice cocktail and the Grand Marnier.
ingredients: 2 well-chilled 750-ml. bottles champagne or sparkling cider
1 cup well-chilled cranberry juice cocktail, or to taste
3 tablespoons Grand Marnier or other orange-flavored liqueur, or to taste, if desired
step_by_step_instructions: In a large pitcher, stir together the champagne, cranberry juice cocktail, and Grand Marnier.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a baking pan, spread seeds evenly and toast, stirring once halfway through toasting, until seeds are deep golden, about 12 minutes. Cool seeds, and in a food processor, pulse with salt until coarsely ground. Sesame salt may be made 2 weeks ahead and kept, covered, at room temperature.
In a saucepan, cover eggs with cold water by 1 inch and bring just to a boil. Remove pan from heat and let eggs stand, covered, 7 minutes for quail eggs or 17 minutes for chicken eggs. Drain water from pan and run cold water over eggs, cracking shells against side of pan. Peel eggs, and quarter chicken eggs if using. Serve eggs with sesame salt.
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
In a baking pan, spread the sesame seeds evenly.
Toast the seeds in the oven, stirring once halfway through, until the seeds are deep golden, about 12 minutes.
Cool the seeds.
In a food processor, pulse the seeds with salt until coarsely ground.
In a saucepan, cover eggs with cold water by 1 inch and bring just to a boil.
Remove the pan from heat and let the eggs stand, covered, for 17 minutes for chicken eggs.
Drain the water from the pan and run cold water over the eggs.
Crack the eggshells against the side of the pan.
Peel the eggs.
Quarter the chicken eggs if using.
Serve the eggs with sesame salt.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Slice the pound cake horizontally into 3 pieces. Place the first slice in a loaf tin lined with plastic wrap. Cover the cake with the vanilla ice cream, followed by three-quarters of the chopped peanut butter cups. Add a second layer of cake and cover with the chocolate ice cream, followed by three-quarters of the chocolate candies. Place the last layer of cake on top, followed by the chocolate chip ice cream. Cover with the chocolate shell sauce, then the remaining peanut butter cups and chocolate candies. Let the sauce set for a few seconds, then fold over the plastic wrap and place in the freezer until frozen, about 4 hours.
When ready to serve, pull back the plastic wrap, gently lift the cake out and peel off the wrapping completely. Slice to serve.
ingredients: 1 cup vanilla ice cream, slightly softened
4 large peanut butter cup candies, roughly chopped
1 cup chocolate ice cream, slightly softened
1/2 cup chocolate candies, such as M and Ms, roughly chopped
1 cup chocolate chip ice cream, slightly softened
Chocolate shell ice cream sauce (the type that hardens), such as Smucker's Magic Shell, for covering the top
step_by_step_instructions: Slice the pound cake horizontally into 3 pieces.
Place the first slice in a loaf tin lined with plastic wrap.
Cover the cake with the vanilla ice cream.
Add three-quarters of the chopped peanut butter cups on top of the vanilla ice cream.
Place the second slice of cake on top.
Cover with the chocolate ice cream.
Add three-quarters of the chopped chocolate candies on top of the chocolate ice cream.
Place the last layer of cake on top.
Cover with the chocolate chip ice cream.
Pour the chocolate shell sauce over the top.
Add the remaining chopped peanut butter cups and chocolate candies on top.
Let the sauce set for a few seconds.
Fold over the plastic wrap to cover the cake.
Place in the freezer until frozen, about 4 hours.
When ready to serve, pull back the plastic wrap, lift the cake out and peel off completely.
Slice to serve.

original_instructions:
Set a saucepan over high heat. Pour in the milk and water. Add the salt and vanilla extract. Bring the liquids to a boil.
When the milky water is boiling, pour in the oats. Stir quite vigorously. When the water returns to a boil, turn down the heat to low. Simmer the oats, stirring every few minutes, until the oats are creamy and plump, the liquid fully absorbed, about 15 minutes.
Turn off the heat and cover the pan. Let the oatmeal sit for five minutes to fully absorb the liquid.
Top with your favorite sweetener and fruit. (This one is maple syrup, peaches, and blackberries.)
Variations: If you cannot eat dairy, almond milk or hemp milk work well here too.
If you have a fresh vanilla bean, scrape the insides of it into the pot instead of vanilla extract. This will be the best oatmeal you have ever eaten.
step_by_step_instructions: Set a saucepan over high heat.
Pour in the milk and water.
Add the salt and vanilla extract.
Bring the liquids to a boil.
When the milky water is boiling, pour in the oats.
Stir quite vigorously.
When the water returns to a boil, turn down the heat to low.
Simmer the oats, stirring every few minutes, until the oats are creamy and plump, the liquid fully absorbed, about 15 minutes.
Turn off the heat and cover the pan.
Let the oatmeal sit for five minutes to fully absorb the liquid.
Top with your favorite sweetener and fruit.

original_instructions:
Place the onions in a small bowl and cover with cold water. Let soak for 15 minutes. Drain.
Meanwhile, using a small knife and your hands, remove the skin, bones, and any brown bits from the whitefish and discard. Flake the whitefish into small pieces into a medium bowl, checking again for any bones.
Add the egg and onion to the whitefish and mash together with a fork. Stir in the mayonnaise and lemon juice. (For a smoother textured salad, pulse the whitefish mixture in a food processor.) Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately or store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Place the onions in a small bowl and cover with cold water.
Let soak for 15 minutes.
Drain the onions.
Using a small knife and your hands, remove the skin, bones, and any brown bits from the whitefish.
Flake the whitefish into small pieces into a medium bowl, checking again for any bones.
Add the egg and onion to the whitefish and mash together with a fork.
Stir in the mayonnaise and lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately or store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

original_instructions:
Place onion slices in a medium bowl. Pour vinegar and 1/2 cup warm water over onion. Stir in sugar and season with salt; let stand until slightly pickled, about 30 minutes. Drain. DO AHEAD: Can be made 2 days ahead. Let cool slightly. Cover and refrigerate.
Place onion slices in a medium bowl. Pour vinegar and 1/2 cup warm water over onion. Stir in sugar and season with salt; let stand until slightly pickled, about 30 minutes. Drain. DO AHEAD: Can be made 2 days ahead. Let cool slightly. Cover and refrigerate.
ingredients: 1 medium red onion, thinly sliced (about 1 cup)
1/4 cup red wine vinegar or apple cider vinegar
step_by_step_instructions: Place onion slices in a medium bowl.
Pour vinegar and 1/2 cup warm water over onion.
Stir in sugar and season with salt.
Let stand until slightly pickled, about 30 minutes.
Drain the liquid from the onions.
Cool slightly and store in the refrigerator.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
Lay the pepperoni slices in a single layer on a baking sheet and bake for 8 to 10 minutes.
Remove the pan from the oven and soak up the excess grease by pressing paper towels against the pepperoni chips. Return the pan to the oven and bake an additional 2 to 4 minutes, until the pepperoni slices are very crispy.
Serve as a snack anytime or use in place of crackers for dipping or for topping with your favorite cheese! They'll stay fresh and crispy for 1 to 2 days if you store them in an airtight container.
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
Lay the pepperoni slices in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Bake for 8 to 10 minutes.
Remove the pan from the oven and soak up the excess grease by pressing paper towels against the pepperoni chips.
Return the pan to the oven and bake an additional 2 to 4 minutes, until the pepperoni slices are very crispy.
Serve the pepperoni chips as a snack anytime or use in place of crackers for dipping or for topping with your favorite cheese.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Heat a small skillet with the butter over medium heat. Add the onions, season with salt ground thyme, bay leaf and cook until very soft and sweet and lightly caramelized, 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, to taste, and discard the bay leaf.
While the onions cook, put the potatoes in a medium pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil, then salt the water and cook to tender, 12 to 15 minutes. Drain and return the potatoes to the hot pot. Mash the potatoes with the cream and Parmesan and season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Preheat the broiler.
Arrange the mashed potatoes in individual gratin dishes or 1 shallow casserole. Top the potatoes with the onions and Gruyere cheese. Put them on a sheet pan and brown under a hot broiler until bubbly, about 2 minutes. Remove from the oven and serve hot.
ingredients: 1 large or 2 medium sweet onions, such as Vidalia, thinly sliced
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 pounds baby Yukon gold potatoes or fingerling potatoes
1/2 pound brick Gruyere or Swiss cheese, shredded
step_by_step_instructions: Heat a small skillet with butter over medium heat.
Add the onions and season with salt, ground thyme, and a bay leaf.
Cook the onions until they are very soft, sweet, and lightly caramelized, about 20 minutes.
Season onions with salt and pepper to taste, then discard the bay leaf.
While the onions cook, put potatoes in a medium pot and cover with water.
Bring the pot to a boil, then salt the water.
Cook the potatoes until they are tender, about 12 to 15 minutes.
Drain the potatoes and return them to the hot pot.
Mash the potatoes with cream and Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese.
Season the mashed potatoes with salt and pepper to taste.
Preheat the broiler.
Arrange the mashed potatoes in individual gratin dishes or a shallow casserole.
Top the potatoes with onions and shredded Gruyere cheese.
Place on a sheet pan and brown under a hot broiler until bubbly, about 2 minutes.
Remove from the oven and serve hot.

original_instructions: Puree banana with yogurt and season with some superfine sugar and a dash of rum. Spoon into the bottom of wine glasses and spoon grapes over the top; garnish with mint or pistachios.
ingredients: 1 ripe small banana, peeled and sliced
1 1/2 cups red seedless grapes, rinsed and halved
Mint leaves, or chopped pistachio nuts for garnish
step_by_step_instructions: Puree banana with yogurt and season with superfine sugar and a dash of rum.
Spoon the mixture into the bottom of wine glasses.
Spoon grapes over the top of the mixture.
Garnish with mint.

original_instructions:
In a bowl whisk together the vinegar, the mustard, the sugar, the water, and salt and pepper to taste, add the oil in a stream, whisking, and whisk the dressing until it is emulsified. Add the chicory and the carrot and toss the salad well.
In a bowl whisk together the vinegar, the mustard, the sugar, the water, and salt and pepper to taste, add the oil in a stream, whisking, and whisk the dressing until it is emulsified. Add the chicory and the carrot and toss the salad well.
ingredients: 2 teaspoon Sherry vinegar (available at specialty foods shops and supermarkets)
1 bunch of chicory, rinsed, spun dry, and torn into pieces (about 4 cups packed)
step_by_step_instructions: In a bowl, whisk together the vinegar, mustard, sugar, water, and salt and pepper to taste.
Add the oil in a stream while whisking continuously.
Whisk the dressing until it is emulsified.
Add the chicory and the carrot to the dressing.
Toss the salad well to combine.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Whip eggs, sugar and salt until tripled in volume. Fold in flour. Pour mixture into parchment lined 9 by 11-inch baking pan and bake for 25 to 30 minutes. Set aside to cool.
Remove parchment paper and return cake to pan. With a fork, poke holes all over the top of the cake. Combine remaining ingredients and pour over cake. Allow liquid to soak in for 2 hours. Serve with fresh fruit and whipped cream.
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Whip eggs, sugar, and salt until tripled in volume.
Fold in flour.
Pour mixture into parchment-lined 9 by 11-inch baking pan.
Bake for 25 to 30 minutes.
Set aside to cool.
Remove parchment paper and return cake to pan.
With a fork, poke holes all over the top of the cake.
Combine the remaining ingredients.
Pour the liquid over the cake.
Allow the liquid to soak in for 2 hours.
Serve with fresh fruit and whipped cream.

original_instructions:
Bring stock to a boil in a nonreactive saucepan (do not use aluminum which will react with eggs which come into play later on).
Add bay leaf, sage, thyme and garlic cloves and cook, covered, at a bare simmer for 30 minutes.
Strain broth and discard herbs; pass and press garlic through to liquid and season to taste with salt. In a mixing bowl combine the cheese with egg and yolk, olive oil and pepper to taste. Everything can be done in advance up to this point.
Just before serving, reheat the soup and drizzle a ladleful of hot soup into the egg and oil mixture to temper the eggs. Pour this tempered mixture back into the soup and whisk continuously over low heat until the soup thickens slightly. Take care not to over heat or the eggs will curdle.
Set a piece of French bread crouton in center of soup plate and ladle soup over the top. Garnish with parsley.
ingredients: 1 quart chicken stock, preferably homemade or half of stock and water
1 ounce each of freshly grated Parmesan and Swiss cheese
4 toasted bread croutons made of sliced French bread, optional
1 to 2 tablespoons chopped parsley for garnish
step_by_step_instructions: Bring chicken stock to a boil in a nonreactive saucepan.
Add bay leaf, sage, thyme, and garlic cloves. Cook, covered, at a bare simmer for 30 minutes.
Strain broth and discard herbs. Press garlic through to liquid and season with salt.
In a mixing bowl, combine cheese with egg and yolk, olive oil, and black pepper.
Reheat the soup.
Drizzle a ladleful of hot soup into the egg and oil mixture to temper the eggs.
Pour this tempered mixture back into the soup and whisk continuously over low heat until the soup thickens slightly. Do not overheat.
Set a piece of French bread crouton in center of soup plate and ladle soup over the top.
Garnish with parsley.

recipe_title: Dijon Chicken with Grape and Pine Nut Salsa
original_instructions:
Whisk together mustards and wine. Pour over chicken; cover, refrigerate, and marinate 24 hours.
To prepare salsa combine grapes, pine nuts, red onion, green onion, parsley, oil, vinegar, and sugar; mix well. Season with salt and pepper.
Preheat grill.
Season each chicken breast half with salt and pepper.
Grill or broil chicken until firm and juices run clear, 8 to 10 minutes, turning once.
Plate chicken and top with 1/2 cup grape salsa.
Calories 261; Protein 28g; Fat 10g; Calories from Fat 36%; Carbohydrate 13g; Cholesterol 66mg; Fiber 1.6g; Sodium 510mg
ingredients: 1/2 cup dry white wine or chicken stock
40 breast halves, 4 oz. each boneless, skinless chicken
3 lbs., 12 oz. California seedless grapes, halved
2 1/2 oz. (1 1/4 cups) fresh Italian parsley, chopped
Salt and fresh ground pepper, as needed
step_by_step_instructions: Whisk together mustard and wine.
Pour the mixture over chicken; cover, refrigerate, and marinate for 24 hours.
To prepare salsa, combine grapes, pine nuts, red onion, green onion, parsley, oil, vinegar, and sugar; mix well.
Season the salsa with salt and pepper.
Preheat grill.
Season each chicken breast half with salt and pepper.
Grill or broil chicken until firm and juices run clear, 8 to 10 minutes, turning once.
Plate chicken and top with 1/2 cup grape salsa.

original_instructions:
In a large soup pot, heat the oil over high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-high, add the carrot, celery and onion and saute for 5 minutes. Add the garlic and saute for another 1 to 2 minutes.
Add the cabbage to the pot and cook, covered, stirring regularly to prevent burning, until softened, 6 to 8 minutes. Add the kielbasa and mustard and then add the chicken broth. Bring to a simmer and cook until the carrots are tender, 15 to 20 minutes.
In a bowl, mix together the butter and flour to form a buerre manier. Whisk the buerre manier into the soup and simmer for 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
step_by_step_instructions: Heat the oil in a large soup pot over high heat.
Reduce the heat to medium-high, add the carrot, celery, and onion, and saute for 5 minutes.
Add the garlic and saute for another 1 to 2 minutes.
Add the cabbage to the pot and cook, covered, stirring regularly, until softened, 6 to 8 minutes.
Add the kielbasa and mustard, then add the chicken broth.
Bring to a simmer and cook until the carrots are tender, 15 to 20 minutes.
In a bowl, mix together the butter and flour to form a buerre manier.
Whisk the buerre manier into the soup and simmer for 20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.

original_instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash potatoes and poke 2 or 3 vent holes in each with a fork. Bake potatoes in oven until done, about 1 hour. (Poke with a fork and if fork goes in easily they are done). Remove potatoes from oven and allow to cool for 10 minutes. Slice potatoes in 1/2 lengthwise and scoop pulp into mixing bowl being careful not to break skin. Mash potatoes with butter, cheese, milk, and chives. Taste-test and adjust seasoning if necessary with salt and pepper. Spoon mashed potatoes back into skins and place in a 9 by 13-inch dish. Return to oven and heat thoroughly.
ingredients: 3/4 cup milk, plus more if needed
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees.
Wash potatoes and poke 2 or 3 vent holes in each with a fork.
Bake potatoes in oven until done, about 1 hour.
Poke with a fork and if fork goes in easily they are done.
Remove potatoes from oven and allow to cool for 10 minutes.
Slice potatoes in half lengthwise and scoop pulp into mixing bowl being careful not to break skin.
Mash potatoes with butter, cheese, milk, and chives.
Taste-test and adjust seasoning if necessary with salt and pepper.
Spoon mashed potatoes back into skins and place in a 9 by 13-inch dish.
Return to oven and heat thoroughly.

recipe_title: Big Daddy's Sweet Corn Spoon Bread
original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Combine the corn and eggs in blender and puree until thick and smooth. Transfer the puree to a bowl. Add the butter, sugar and milk and fold gently to incorporate well. Stir in the mozzarella cheese and bacon. Add the smoked paprika, cayenne, salt and pepper. The mixture should be thick and creamy.
Pour the corn mixture into a greased souffle dish and sprinkle with the Parmesan and parsley. Bake until browned, about 45 minutes. Let cool for about 15 minutes before serving. Serve warm.
ingredients: 2 1/2 cups corn kernels, fresh or frozen and thawed
6 slices bacon, cooked crisp and crumbled
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Combine the corn and eggs in a blender and puree until thick and smooth.
Transfer the puree to a bowl.
Add the butter, sugar, and milk to the bowl and fold gently to incorporate well.
Stir in the mozzarella cheese and bacon.
Add the smoked paprika, cayenne, salt, and pepper, stirring until the mixture is thick and creamy.
Pour the corn mixture into a greased souffle dish.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and parsley.
Bake until browned, about 45 minutes.
Let cool for about 15 minutes before serving.
Serve warm.

original_instructions:
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over medium heat. Add the potatoes and cook until just tender. Drain and turn out onto a cutting board. Smash the potatoes with the side of a large knife or spatula.
Heat a large cast iron skillet over medium-high heat and add the olive oil. When the pan is very hot, but not smoking, add the cipollini onions, and cook until starting to caramelize, about 4 to 5 minutes Add in the drained artichokes and season with salt and pepper, to taste. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes before turning them so that they will caramelize. Add the potatoes and cook until the potatoes are starting to brown, then stir in the garlic and the thyme. Slowly pour in the chicken stock, scraping up the bits from the bottom of the pan. Sprinkle with the vinegar and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper, if necessary. Transfer to a platter and garnish with chopped parsley.
ingredients: 6 cipollini onions, peeled, sliced in half along equator
1 (15-ounce) jar artichokes, (not marinated), with stems, drained, roughly chopped
step_by_step_instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over medium heat.
Add the potatoes and cook until just tender.
Drain and turn out onto a cutting board.
Smash the potatoes with the side of a large knife or spatula.
Heat a large cast iron skillet over medium-high heat and add the olive oil.
When the pan is very hot, but not smoking, add the onions, and cook until starting to caramelize, about 4 to 5 minutes.
Add in the drained artichokes and season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Cook for 2 to 3 minutes before turning them so that they will caramelize.
Add the potatoes and cook until the potatoes are starting to brown.
Stir in the garlic and the thyme.
Slowly pour in the chicken stock, scraping up the bits from the bottom of the pan.
Sprinkle with the vinegar and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper, if necessary.
Transfer to a platter and garnish with chopped parsley.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees.
Halve the sweet potatoes lengthwise and cut each half into 3 long spears. Place them on a sheet pan and toss with the olive oil. Spread the potatoes in one layer. Combine the brown sugar, salt, and pepper and sprinkle on the potatoes. Bake for 15 minutes and then turn with a spatula. Bake for another 5 to 10 minutes, until lightly browned. Sprinkle lightly with salt and serve hot.
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, plus extra for sprinkling
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees.
Halve the sweet potatoes lengthwise.
Cut each half into 3 long spears.
Place the spears on a sheet pan.
Toss the spears with olive oil.
Spread the potatoes in one layer.
Combine the brown sugar, salt, and pepper.
Sprinkle the sugar mixture on the potatoes.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Turn the potatoes with a spatula.
Bake for another 5 to 10 minutes, until lightly browned.
Sprinkle lightly with salt.
Serve hot.

original_instructions: Cook the garlic in olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until golden brown and crispy, about 3 minutes; take care that the garlic doesn't get too brown or it will be bitter. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the garlic chips to a paper towel. Add the onions and red pepper (add a little more if you like things spicy) to the skillet and cook, stirring, until light brown, about 10 minutes. When the onions are almost done, add the greens in batches and cook, uncovered, just until tender, about 2 minutes. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a serving dish. Top with the reserved garlic chips and garnish with cheese.
ingredients: 2 medium yellow onions, halved and sliced (3 to 4 cups)
18 cups torn greens, such as mustard, kale, chard, escarole, or a mix (about 3 large bunches)
step_by_step_instructions: Cook the garlic in olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until golden brown and crispy, about 3 minutes.
Using a slotted spoon, transfer the garlic chips to a paper towel.
Add the onions and red pepper to the skillet and cook, stirring, until light brown, about 10 minutes.
When the onions are almost done, add the greens in batches and cook, uncovered, just until tender, about 2 minutes.
Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 5 minutes.
Transfer to a serving dish.
Top with the reserved garlic chips and garnish with cheese.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly butter 6 (6-ounce) ramekins.
Whisk the oats, flour, brown sugar, pecans, and salt in a medium bowl. Rub in the butter with your fingertips until it is in even, pea-size pieces. Peel, core, and coarsely chop the apples and divide evenly among the ramekins. Scatter the crisp topping evenly over the fruit in each ramekin.
Transfer the ramekins to a baking sheet and cook until the fruit bubbles around the sides and the top is golden, about 30 minutes.
Preheat a broiler. Place the crisps about 4 inches from the broiler and cook until golden brown, about 30 seconds. Let cool about 15 minutes before serving. Serve warm with whipped cream, if using.
In our diabetic-friendly desserts, we use small amounts of sweeteners in accordance with guidelines set up by the American Diabetic Association. As with all sweets, moderation is important.
ingredients: 6 tablespoons cold unsalted butter, cut into bits
4 medium baking apples, such as Braeburn, Rome, or Golden Delicious,
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Lightly butter 6 (6-ounce) ramekins.
In a medium bowl, whisk the oats, flour, brown sugar, pecans, and salt.
Rub in the butter with your fingertips until it is in even, pea-size pieces.
Peel, core, and coarsely chop the apples.
Divide the chopped apples evenly among the ramekins.
Scatter the crisp topping evenly over the fruit in each ramekin.
Transfer the ramekins to a baking sheet.
Bake until the fruit bubbles around the sides and the top is golden, about 30 minutes.
Preheat a broiler.
Place the crisps about 4 inches from the broiler and cook until golden brown, about 30 seconds.
Let cool about 15 minutes before serving.
Serve warm with whipped cream, if using.

recipe_title: Sugar Snap Pea and Cabbage Slaw
original_instructions:
Toss together cabbage and peas in a large bowl. Whisk together remaining ingredients and pour over slaw, stirring to combine well. Add salt to taste, then chill, covered, at least 2 hours.
Toss together cabbage and peas in a large bowl. Whisk together remaining ingredients and pour over slaw, stirring to combine well. Add salt to taste, then chill, covered, at least 2 hours.
ingredients: 2 1/2 pounds green cabbage (preferably Savoy), quartered, cored, and thinly sliced (14 cups)
3/4 pound sugar snap peas, trimmed and thinly sliced diagonally (4 cups)
step_by_step_instructions: Toss together cabbage and peas in a large bowl.
Whisk together buttermilk, sour cream, dill, garlic, salt, and black pepper.
Pour the dressing over the cabbage and peas, stirring to combine well.
Add salt to taste.
Cover the slaw and chill for at least 2 hours.

original_instructions:
Boil salted water. Have ice water ready on the side. Poach shrimp for just 30 seconds and cool in ice water and drain. Combine with fish and toss with onion, ginger, garlic, hot pepper, celery, salt, and black pepper. Allow to cool in the refrigerator at least 30 minutes up to 2 hours.
Add juices and refrigerate 1 hour. Finish with cilantro and corn, check seasoning and serve in a martini glass.
ingredients: 1 pound medium shrimp (16/20 per pound), peeled and cleaned
2 pounds meaty white fish, like sea bass, boned, and cut into large dice
1/4 habanero or Scotch bonnet, minced (no seeds or ribs)
2 ears of corn, grill with husk on
step_by_step_instructions: Boil salted water.
Have ice water ready on the side.
Poach shrimp for just 30 seconds.
Cool shrimp in ice water and drain.
Combine shrimp with fish.
Toss with onion, ginger, garlic, hot pepper, celery, salt, and black pepper.
Allow to cool in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes up to 2 hours.
Add lemon and lime juices and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Finish with cilantro and grilled corn.
Check seasoning and serve in a martini glass.

recipe_title: Seared Coriander and Fenugreek Crusted Tuna with Onion Chutney and Pita Crisps
original_instructions:
Cut tuna into strips 1-inch high by 1-inch wide. Chill tuna in the fridge to air dry a bit.
Toast coriander seeds and fenugreek in a dry skillet. Grind with peppercorns in a coffee grinder or spice grinder. Place mix in a pie plate.
Meanwhile make the garnishes. For the chutney: in a food processor combine onion, cilantro, ginger, chili peppers, lemon juice and season with salt and fresh pepper. Blend til well combined. Cut pita bread into triangles and fry in hot oil. Drain on paper towel.
