Heat a skillet til very hot. Roll tuna in the spice mix. Add a little oil to the pan. Sear the tuna on all 4 sides. Slice thin and serve with pita triangles and chutney. Sprinkle with more chopped cilantro.
ingredients: Center cut, sushi quality tuna, (you'll need about 3 pounds to yield some choice pieces)
3 tablespoons each coriander and fenugreek seeds
step_by_step_instructions: Cut tuna into strips 1-inch high by 1-inch wide.
Chill tuna in the fridge to air dry a bit.
Toast coriander seeds and fenugreek in a dry skillet.
Grind with peppercorns in a coffee grinder or spice grinder.
Place spice mix in a pie plate.
In a food processor, combine onion, cilantro, ginger, chili peppers, lemon juice and season with salt and fresh pepper.
Blend until well combined to make the chutney.
Cut pita bread into triangles.
Fry pita triangles in hot oil and drain on paper towel.
Heat a skillet until very hot.
Roll tuna in the spice mix.
Add a little oil to the skillet.
Sear the tuna on all 4 sides.
Slice tuna thinly.
Serve tuna with pita triangles and chutney.
Sprinkle with more chopped cilantro.

original_instructions: Blanch broccoli rabe in a large pot of boiling salted water for 2-3 minutes. Drain and shock in ice bath. Drain and wrap in a dry towel, squeezing out any excesss water. In a large saute pan, cook garlic and crushed red pepper flakes for 1 minute. Add broccoli rabe and cook and stir until heated through. Stir in breadcrumbs and toss all together. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
step_by_step_instructions: Blanch broccoli rabe in a large pot of boiling salted water for 2-3 minutes.
Drain the broccoli rabe and shock it in an ice bath.
Drain again and wrap the broccoli rabe in a dry towel, squeezing out any excess water.
In a large sauté pan, cook garlic and crushed red pepper flakes for 1 minute.
Add the broccoli rabe to the pan and cook, stirring until heated through.
Stir in breadcrumbs and toss everything together.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

recipe_title: Fresh Homemade Pasta with Wild Mushrooms
original_instructions:
In a saute pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the shallots, garlic, red pepper and quickly saute being careful to avoid browning or burning. Add the mushrooms, season with salt and pepper and saute together for 5 minutes. Add the cream, reduce the heat to prevent the cream from scorching and cook for several minutes while the pasta cooks.
Bring the water to a rolling boil in a large pot and add the salt. Add the pasta to the boiling water.
To the mushrooms, add the basil, pine nuts and Parmesan cheese. The pasta will cook in several minutes after returning to the boil. Add the cooked pasta to the sauce and serve.
ingredients: 2 ounces dried porcini mushrooms, washed and rehydrated
1/2 pound cremini mushrooms, cleaned and sliced
Salt and freshly ground pepper to taste
step_by_step_instructions: In a saute pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the shallots, garlic, red pepper and quickly saute, being careful to avoid browning or burning.
Add the mushrooms, season with salt and pepper and saute together for 5 minutes.
Add the cream, reduce the heat to prevent the cream from scorching and cook for several minutes while the pasta cooks.
Bring the water to a rolling boil in a large pot and add the salt.
Add the pasta to the boiling water.
To the mushrooms, add the basil, pine nuts and Parmesan cheese.
The pasta will cook in several minutes after returning to the boil.
Add the cooked pasta to the sauce and serve.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
For the lime curd: Combine the lime juice, sugar and butter in a medium saucepan and cook on a low flame until the butter melts. Beat the eggs, add to the saucepan and stir until combined. Bring to a simmer. Stir constantly and cook until the mixture is a thick and creamy consistency, 5 to7 minutes. Pass through a mesh strainer. Chill for 2 hours in the fridge.
For the crust: Add the sugar and graham crackers to a food processor. Pour in the melted butter and pulse to combine.
For the topping: Whip the cream with the sugar until stiff.
To assemble, layer the crumb mixture into the bottom of a serving cup, followed by the lime curd. Top with the whipped cream mixture and garnish with lime zest.
step_by_step_instructions: Combine the lime juice, sugar, and butter in a medium saucepan.
Cook on a low flame until the butter melts.
Beat the eggs and add to the saucepan.
Stir until combined.
Bring the mixture to a simmer, stirring constantly.
Cook until the mixture is thick and creamy, 5 to 7 minutes.
Pass the mixture through a mesh strainer.
Chill the lime curd in the fridge for 2 hours.
Add the sugar and graham crackers to a food processor.
Pour in the melted butter and pulse to combine.
Whip the cream with the sugar until stiff.
Layer the crumb mixture into the bottom of a serving cup.
Add a layer of lime curd on top of the crumbs.
Top with the whipped cream mixture.
Garnish with lime zest.

original_instructions: Warm a griddle or nonstick pan over medium-high heat. Then add 1 tablespoon butter until warmed. Next, add the bread in batches to the griddle and allow to brown or crisp on the first side, 1 to 2 minutes. After browning, flip the bread and repeat the process on the second side. Season with salt and pepper. Remove after browning and serve.
ingredients: 6 slices fresh thick-sliced Texas toast (BBQ sliced bread)
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Warm a griddle or nonstick pan over medium-high heat.
Add 1 tablespoon butter until warmed.
Add the bread in batches to the griddle.
Allow to brown or crisp on the first side, 1 to 2 minutes.
Flip the bread and repeat the process on the second side.
Season with salt and pepper.
Remove after browning and serve.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Whisk the olive oil, Worcestershire sauce, hot sauce, garlic powder, cumin, onion powder, cayenne and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a bowl.
Combine the rice cereal squares, cornflakes, pita chips and pepitas in a bowl. Toss with the spice mixture and spread on a baking sheet. Bake, stirring occasionally, until golden, about 40 minutes.
Per serving (1/3 cup): Calories 100; Fat 5 g (Saturated 1 g); Cholesterol 0 mg; Sodium 220 mg; Carbohydrate 13 g; Fiber 2 g; Protein 3 g
;
ingredients: 3 cups rice cereal squares 1 cup cornflakes
2/3 cup whole-grain pita chips, broken into small pieces
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Whisk the olive oil, Worcestershire sauce, hot sauce, garlic powder, cumin, onion powder, cayenne, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a bowl.
Combine the rice cereal squares, cornflakes, pita chips, and pepitas in a bowl.
Toss with the spice mixture.
Spread on a baking sheet.
Bake, stirring occasionally, until golden, about 40 minutes.

recipe_title: Salmon Chowder with Yukon Gold Potatoes
original_instructions: Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the leeks and garlic and cook, stirring, until softened, about 3 minutes. Add the tarragon and cook 1 minute, until fragrant. Add the potatoes and broth and bring to a simmer. Partially cover the pan and simmer until the potatoes are fork-tender, 8 to 10 minutes. Stir in the salmon and milk and simmer 2 minutes to heat through. Remove from the heat, season to taste with salt and pepper, and serve.
ingredients: 2 leeks (white part only), rinsed well and chopped
2 medium-size Yukon gold potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes
4 cups reduced-sodium chicken or vegetable broth
1 1/2 cups leftover salmon broken into pieces
1 (12-ounce) can evaporated fat-free milk or lowfat milk
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
Add the leeks and garlic and cook, stirring, until softened, about 3 minutes.
Add the tarragon and cook 1 minute, until fragrant.
Add the potatoes and broth and bring to a simmer.
Partially cover the pan and simmer until the potatoes are fork-tender, 8 to 10 minutes.
Stir in the salmon and milk and simmer 2 minutes to heat through.
Remove from the heat, season to taste with salt and pepper, and serve.

recipe_title: Warm Dijon Potato Salad with Green Beans
original_instructions:
Place the potatoes in a large pot and cover with cold water by at least a couple inches. Salt the water generously, bring to a boil and cook until the potatoes are fork tender, about 20 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold water.
Bring another pot of salted water to a boil and throw the beans in just for a minute or two until they turn bright green. Strain them and run them under cold water to stop the beans from cooking.
In a mixing bowl combine the remaining ingredients and whisk until smooth.
Cut the potatoes in half lengthwise and then into roughly 1 inch chunks. Cut beans in half. Toss the potato chunks in the dressing and then toss in the green beans and the parsley.
ingredients: 3 pounds Yukon or baby white potatoes
1/3 cup packed finely chopped flat-leaf parsley
step_by_step_instructions: Place the potatoes in a large pot and cover with cold water by at least a couple inches.
Salt the water generously, bring to a boil and cook until the potatoes are fork tender, about 20 minutes.
Drain and rinse the potatoes under cold water.
Bring another pot of salted water to a boil.
Throw the beans in just for a minute or two until they turn bright green.
Strain the beans and run them under cold water to stop the cooking process.
In a mixing bowl, combine mayonnaise, whole grain Dijon mustard, shallot, red wine vinegar, and black pepper, and whisk until smooth.
Cut the potatoes in half lengthwise and then into roughly 1 inch chunks.
Cut beans in half.
Toss the potato chunks in the dressing.
Toss in the green beans and the parsley.

recipe_title: Roasted Potatoes, Carrots and Shallots with Rosemary
original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 400°F. Combine potatoes, carrots, shallots and oil in large bowl. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Toss to coat. Transfer vegetables to roasting pan. Roast until vegetables are almost tender, stirring occasionally, about 45 minutes. Add rosemary and roast until vegetables are golden brown and tender, about 15 minutes longer. Transfer vegetables to bowl.
Preheat oven to 400°F. Combine potatoes, carrots, shallots and oil in large bowl. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Toss to coat. Transfer vegetables to roasting pan. Roast until vegetables are almost tender, stirring occasionally, about 45 minutes. Add rosemary and roast until vegetables are golden brown and tender, about 15 minutes longer. Transfer vegetables to bowl.
ingredients: 1 3/4 pounds medium-size red-skinned potatoes, cut into 3/4-inch pieces
6 medium carrots, peeled, cut into 2-inch pieces
1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh rosemary or 1 1/2 teaspoons dried
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Combine potatoes, carrots, shallots and oil in large bowl.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Toss to coat.
Transfer vegetables to roasting pan.
Roast until vegetables are almost tender, stirring occasionally, about 45 minutes.
Add rosemary.
Roast until vegetables are golden brown and tender, about 15 minutes longer.
Transfer vegetables to bowl.

original_instructions: In a bowl, combine 1-ounce bread crumbs, hot pepper sauce, Worcestershire, mayonnaise, parsley, peppers, egg white, scallion, lemon juice, old bay, dry mustard, onion powder, and Dijon mustard. Once combined, gently fold in crabmeat. Once fully incorporated, form into 2 to 3 inch cakes. Dredge in remaining bread crumbs. Pan fry in hot oil until golden brown on both sides.;
step_by_step_instructions: In a bowl, combine 1-ounce bread crumbs, hot pepper sauce, Worcestershire sauce, mayonnaise, parsley, green pepper, red pepper, egg white, scallion, lemon juice, crab boil seasoning, dry mustard, onion powder, and Dijon mustard.
Gently fold in crabmeat.
Once fully incorporated, form mixture into 2 to 3 inch cakes.
Dredge each cake in the remaining bread crumbs.
Pan fry the cakes in hot oil until they are golden brown on both sides.

original_instructions:
Heat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Using 1 tablespoon butter, grease the bottom and sides of an 8 by 8-inch baking pan.
To make the topping: In a small bowl, mash together the peanuts, flour, brown sugar, and a pinch of salt. Using your fingertips, mix in the butter. Set aside.
To make the bars: In a stand mixer, blend the butter, peanut butter, and brown sugar until light and creamy. Add the egg, vanilla extract, baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt in order, scraping down the sides as needed. Slowly blend in the flour then fold in the chocolate chips and shredded coconut. Press into the bottom of the prepared dish, then spread the jelly over the entire dish.
Sprinkle the reserved peanut topping over the top and bake until the edges and topping are golden brown, about 30 to 35 minutes. Allow it to cool before slicing.
ingredients: 1 stick, plus 1 tablespoon butter, at room temperature
step_by_step_instructions: Heat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Using 1 tablespoon butter, grease the bottom and sides of an 8 by 8-inch baking pan.
In a small bowl, mash together the peanuts, flour, brown sugar, and a pinch of salt for the topping.
Using your fingertips, mix in the butter into the topping and set aside.
In a stand mixer, blend the butter, peanut butter, and brown sugar until light and creamy to make the bars.
Add the egg, vanilla extract, baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt to the mixture, scraping down the sides as needed.
Slowly blend in the flour then fold in the chocolate chips and shredded coconut.
Press the mixture into the bottom of the prepared dish.
Spread the strawberry jam over the entire dish.
Sprinkle the reserved peanut topping over the top.
Bake until the edges and topping are golden brown, about 30 to 35 minutes.
Allow it to cool before slicing.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Place the yogurt in a cheesecloth or paper towel-lined sieve and set it over a bowl. Grate the cucumber and toss it with 1 tablespoon of kosher salt; place it in another sieve, and set it over another bowl. Place both bowls in the refrigerator for 3 to 4 hours so the yogurt and cucumber can drain.
Transfer the thickened yogurt to a large bowl. Squeeze as much liquid from the cucumber as you can and add the cucumber to the yogurt. Mix in the sour cream, vinegar, lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, dill, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and pepper. You can serve it immediately, but I prefer to allow the tzatziki to sit in the refrigerator for a few hours for the flavors to blend. Serve chilled or at room temperature.
ingredients: 1 pound (1 pint) plain yogurt (whole milk or low fat)
1 tablespoon Champagne vinegar or white wine vinegar
2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice (1 lemon)
step_by_step_instructions: Place the yogurt in a cheesecloth or paper towel-lined sieve and set it over a bowl.
Grate the cucumber and toss it with 1 tablespoon of salt.
Place the salted cucumber in another sieve, and set it over another bowl.
Place both bowls in the refrigerator for 3 to 4 hours so the yogurt and cucumber can drain.
Transfer the thickened yogurt to a large bowl.
Squeeze as much liquid from the cucumber as you can and add the cucumber to the yogurt.
Mix in the sour cream, vinegar, lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, dill, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and pepper into the yogurt and cucumber mixture.
Serve immediately or allow the tzatziki to sit in the refrigerator for a few hours for the flavors to blend.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

original_instructions:
Shred the cabbage and julienne the carrot (cut into thin slivers). Combine in a bowl with the mayonnaise, ginger and garlic and mix well.
Heat the butter in a medium skillet over a medium flame. Add the raisins and cook until soft and golden brown, about 2 minutes. Mix the warm raisins into the slaw and add the vinegar and salt, sugar and pepper to taste. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon finely minced ginger (from one 1-inch piece)
1 1/2 teaspoons finely minced garlic (from 1 small clove)
step_by_step_instructions: Shred the cabbage and julienne the carrot.
Combine the cabbage and carrot in a bowl with mayonnaise, ginger, and garlic, and mix well.
Heat butter in a medium skillet over medium flame.
Add raisins and cook until soft and golden brown, about 2 minutes.
Mix the warm raisins into the slaw.
Add vinegar, salt, sugar, and pepper to taste.
Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

original_instructions: Mix the ricotta, confectioners' sugar and liqueur in a bowl. Fold in the chocolate chips. Serve with strawberries and wonton triangles, pita chips or cookies for dipping.
ingredients: Strawberries, crispy wonton triangles, cinnamon pita chips or your favorite cookies, for serving
step_by_step_instructions: Mix the ricotta, confectioners' sugar, and liqueur in a bowl.
Fold in the chocolate chips.
Serve with strawberries and the chosen dipping option.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.
Cut the wings tips off the wings and reserve for another use, such as stock. Cut the wings in 1/2 at the joint.
In a bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, mustard, vinegar, and salt. Add the wings and toss them until coated well. In another bowl, toss together the breadcrumbs and caraway seeds and coat the wings with the crumb mixture.
Bake the wings on a rack in a shallow roasting pan, turning once, until lightly browned, about 30 to 35 minutes.
ingredients: 2 cups fine fresh rye bread crumbs
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.
Cut the wing tips off the wings and reserve for another use.
Cut the wings in half at the joint.
In a bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, mustard, vinegar, and salt.
Add the wings to the bowl and toss them until coated well.
In another bowl, toss together the breadcrumbs and caraway seeds.
Coat the wings with the crumb mixture.
Place the wings on a rack in a shallow roasting pan.
Bake the wings, turning once, until lightly browned, about 30 to 35 minutes.

original_instructions:
Mix all ingredients in medium bowl. Season with salt and pepper. (Can be made 4 hours ahead. Cover; chill.)
Mix all ingredients in medium bowl. Season with salt and pepper. (Can be made 4 hours ahead. Cover; chill.)
ingredients: 3 tablespoons minced seeded jalapeño chilies (about 2 medium)
step_by_step_instructions: Mix all the ingredients in a medium bowl.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cover and chill if preparing ahead.

original_instructions:
In a large pan, cook eggs in butter sunny-side up or over easy. When eggs are just about done, divide tortillas between 2 plates and top with the cheese. Heat in microwave until cheese is melted. Top each tortilla with an egg and top the whole thing with black beans and Creole Sauce.
Saute the garlic, peppers, and onion in olive oil until translucent. Add the remaining ingredients and simmer for about 1/2 hour or until all the flavors have blended to your liking. You'll have extra sauce to use for other recipes. It only gets better with age!
step_by_step_instructions: In a large pan, cook the eggs in butter sunny-side up or over easy.
When the eggs are just about done, divide the tortillas between 2 plates and top them with the cheese.
Heat the tortillas in the microwave until the cheese is melted.
Top each tortilla with an egg.
Top the whole thing with black beans and Creole sauce.
Saute the garlic, peppers, and onion in olive oil until translucent.
Add the remaining ingredients for the Creole sauce and simmer for about 1/2 hour or until all the flavors have blended.

recipe_title: Online Round 2 Recipe - Ham and Cheese Breakfast Burrito
original_instructions:
Heat a skillet over medium heat and add the canola oil. When the oil is hot, cook the ham, red onion, and bell peppers until softened, 4 to 5 minutes. Remove from the pan and set aside.
In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs and salt and pepper.
Coat the skillet with cooking spray and put it over medium-low heat. Add the beaten eggs and gently stir with a spatula or wooden spoon. Cook the eggs until they set, 4 to 5 minutes. Put the cooked ham and vegetables back into the pan and stir to combine.
Wrap the tortillas in a damp towel and microwave for 30 seconds to warm them. Put a tortilla on a plate, add half the egg mixture, and top with half the cheese. Wrap the ends of the tortilla up and then fold in the sides. Repeat for second burrito and serve warm.
ingredients: Reserved ham, from Ham and Egg Tea Sandwiches
Half reserved red onion, from Crispy Wonton Cups with Tuna Salad, diced
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Heat a skillet over medium heat and add the canola oil.
When the oil is hot, cook the ham, red onion, and bell peppers until softened, 4 to 5 minutes.
Remove from the pan and set aside.
In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs and salt and pepper.
Coat the skillet with cooking spray and put it over medium-low heat.
Add the beaten eggs and gently stir with a spatula or wooden spoon.
Cook the eggs until they set, 4 to 5 minutes.
Put the cooked ham and vegetables back into the pan and stir to combine.
Wrap the tortillas in a damp towel and microwave for 30 seconds to warm them.
Put a tortilla on a plate, add half the egg mixture, and top with half the cheese.
Wrap the ends of the tortilla up and then fold in the sides.
Repeat for the second burrito and serve warm.

original_instructions: Peel kohlrabi with a vegetable peeler and cut into 2-inch long julienne strips. Discard coarse stems from watercress. In a large heavy skillet, heat butter and reserved duck fat over moderately high heat until foam subsides and saute kohlrabi, stirring, until crisp-tender, 5 to 10 minutes. Add lemon juice and saute kohlrabi, stirring, 1 minute more. Remove skillet from heat and immediately stir in watercress. Season vegetables with salt and pepper.;
ingredients: 1 tablespoon rendered duck fat or 1 additional tablespoon unsalted butter
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Peel kohlrabi with a vegetable peeler.
Cut kohlrabi into 2-inch long julienne strips.
Discard coarse stems from watercress.
In a large heavy skillet, heat butter and duck fat over moderately high heat until foam subsides.
Saute kohlrabi, stirring, until crisp-tender, about 5 to 10 minutes.
Add lemon juice and saute kohlrabi for 1 minute more, stirring.
Remove the skillet from heat and immediately stir in watercress.
Season vegetables with salt and pepper.

recipe_title: Memphis Style Dry Ribs: Corky's Ribs
original_instructions:
Preheat a grill to medium heat with all of the coals on 1 side.
Grill over indirect heat (meat side down) for approximately 2 hours, turning once, until internal temperature reaches 185 degrees F.
Baste ribs on both sides during cooking with 3 parts water to 1 part BBQ sauce. Once the ribs reach 185 degrees F, baste again with full strength BBQ sauce and sprinkle liberally with dry rib seasoning.
ingredients: One 2- to 2 3/4-pound slab raw St. Louis cut pork spare ribs
1/2 cup favorite BBQ sauce (1 part), plus more for basting (recommended: Corky's)
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat a grill to medium heat with all of the coals on one side.
Place the ribs meat side down on the grill.
Grill over indirect heat for approximately 2 hours, turning once.
During the cooking process, baste the ribs on both sides with a mixture of 3 parts water to 1 part BBQ sauce.
Continue grilling until the internal temperature of the ribs reaches 185 degrees F.
Once the ribs reach 185 degrees F, baste again with full strength BBQ sauce.
Sprinkle liberally with dry rib seasoning.

original_instructions: Fold all ingredients together in a mixing bowl.
step_by_step_instructions: Fold all ingredients together in a mixing bowl.

original_instructions: Heat oven to 450 degrees F. Lightly grease and flour a popover tin. In a large bowl, whisk together flour and salt. In a separate, medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, and 1 tablespoon warm butter. Pour over flour mixture, and fold until just blended. Fill the popover cups 2/3 to 3/4 full. Transfer cups to oven, and bake for 15 minutes. Reduce the temperature to 350 degrees F, and bake 20 minutes more, until well browned and crusty. Remove popovers from the oven, and unmold onto a rack. Puncture the sides with a sharp knife to let steam escape, and serve immediately.;
ingredients: 1 tablespoon unsalted butter, melted, plus more for greasing tin
step_by_step_instructions: Heat oven to 450 degrees F.
Lightly grease and flour a popover tin.
In a large bowl, whisk together flour and salt.
In a separate, medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, and 1 tablespoon warm butter.
Pour over flour mixture, and fold until just blended.
Fill the popover cups 2/3 to 3/4 full.
Transfer cups to oven, and bake for 15 minutes.
Reduce the temperature to 350 degrees F, and bake 20 minutes more, until well browned and crusty.
Remove popovers from the oven, and unmold onto a rack.
Puncture the sides with a sharp knife to let steam escape, and serve immediately.

original_instructions: If the ham comes with the skin still attached, remove most of it with a sharp knife, leaving a layer of fat and a collar of skin around the shank bone. Trim the fat, leaving a layer about 1/3-inch thick, and score the layer remaining into diamonds. Bake the ham on a rack in a roasting pan in a preheated 350 degree oven for 55 minutes. In a blender blend together the ginger, the brown sugar, and the rum, spoon the glaze over the ham, spreading it, and bake the ham for 30 to 35 minutes more, or until the glaze is brown and bubbly. Transfer the ham to a platter, garnish the platter with the parsley, and let the ham stand for 15 minutes before carving.
ingredients: 1 (7 to 8 pound) half (shank end) of a fully cooked cured ham
1/3 cup chopped preserved ginger in syrup
Parsley sprigs for garnish if desired
step_by_step_instructions: If the ham comes with the skin still attached, remove most of it with a sharp knife, leaving a layer of fat and a collar of skin around the shank bone.
Trim the fat, leaving a layer about 1/3-inch thick, and score the layer remaining into diamonds.
Bake the ham on a rack in a roasting pan in a preheated 350 degree oven for 55 minutes.
In a blender, blend together the ginger, brown sugar, and rum.
Spoon the glaze over the ham, spreading it.
Bake the ham for 30 to 35 minutes more, or until the glaze is brown and bubbly.
Transfer the ham to a platter.
Garnish the platter with parsley.
Let the ham stand for 15 minutes before carving.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Place the Brussels sprouts in the feed tube of the food processor fitted with a large slicing disc. (There is no need to core them.) Process the Brussels sprouts until they're all sliced.
Place the butter and olive oil in a large (12-inch) saute pan and heat it over medium heat. Add the sliced Brussels sprouts, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper and saute them, stirring frequently, for about 4 to 5 minutes, until tender but still bright green. Stir in the balsamic vinegar, season to taste, and serve hot.
ingredients: 2 (12-ounce) packages Brussels sprouts, ends and brown leaves trimmed
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Place the Brussels sprouts in the feed tube of the food processor fitted with a large slicing disc.
Process the Brussels sprouts until they're all sliced.
Place the butter and olive oil in a large (12-inch) saute pan and heat it over medium heat.
Add the sliced Brussels sprouts, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper to the pan.
Saute the Brussels sprouts, stirring frequently, for about 4 to 5 minutes, until tender but still bright green.
Stir in the balsamic vinegar.
Season to taste and serve hot.

original_instructions:
Special Equipment: 8 sets of chopsticks, soaked in water for 30 minutes
Preheat an outdoor grill.
Put the beef, onion, parsley, tomato paste, cumin, and paprika in a large bowl and season generously with salt and pepper. Mix everything together with your hands until it is well combined.
Take about 1/2 cup (4 ounces) of the meat mixture and form it into a 5 or 6-inch long hot dog shape on a chopstick. When you have them all made, spray them with the cooking spray and grill them, turning frequently, until cooked through, about 8 to 10 minutes. (Alternately, cook them in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until cooked through, about 8 to 10 minutes.) Serve on pita bread.
ingredients: 1 medium onion, finely chopped, about 1 cup
1/2 bunch fresh parsley, leaves finely chopped, about 1/4 cup
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat an outdoor grill.
Soak chopsticks in water for 30 minutes.
Put ground beef, onion, parsley, tomato paste, cumin, and paprika in a large bowl.
Season the mixture generously with salt and pepper.
Mix everything together with your hands until it is well combined.
Take about 1/2 cup of the meat mixture and form it into a 5 or 6-inch long hot dog shape on a chopstick.
Spray the meat forms with vegetable cooking spray.
Grill the meat forms, turning frequently, until cooked through, about 8 to 10 minutes.
Alternatively, cook them in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until cooked through, about 8 to 10 minutes.
Serve on pita bread.

original_instructions:
Whisk the butter, milk, and pepper together in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Taste and add salt, if desired. Heat until sauce is warmed through. Serve over grilled chicken, pork, or rice.
Place the honey in a microwave-safe container and heat in the microwave for 15 seconds. Remove from the microwave and add the oil to the container. Place the nuts and salt in the bowl of a food processor and pulse for 5 seconds. Then, while the processor is running, very slowly drizzle in the honey and oil. Process until an emulsion is formed and the mixture is smooth; this will take approximately 45 seconds to 1 minute. If the mixture is too thick and doesn't spread easily, add a little more oil.
step_by_step_instructions: Whisk butter, milk, and pepper together in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
Taste the mixture and add salt if desired.
Continue heating until the sauce is warmed through.
Serve the sauce over grilled chicken, pork, or rice.
Place honey in a microwave-safe container and heat in the microwave for 15 seconds.
Remove from the microwave and add oil to the container.
Place the nuts and salt in the bowl of a food processor and pulse for 5 seconds.
While the processor is running, very slowly drizzle in the honey and oil.
Process until an emulsion is formed and the mixture is smooth, approximately 45 seconds to 1 minute.
If the mixture is too thick and doesn't spread easily, add a little more oil.

recipe_title: Caramelized Onions, Cabrales Blue Cheese and Wild Mushroom Flatbread
original_instructions: Heat butter and olive oil in a medium saute pan. Add onions and sugar and cook slowly until soft and caramelized. Heat olive oil in a large saute pan over high heat. Add the mushrooms and saute until golden brown and cooked down. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Preheat grill. Flatten the dough, brush liberally with olive oil and throw on the grill. Grill on one side until golden brown, turn over spread with the mozzarella, onions and mushrooms and blue cheese.
ingredients: 1 pound assorted wild mushrooms (portobello, shiitake, chanterelle, porcini)
step_by_step_instructions: Heat butter and olive oil in a medium saute pan.
Add onions and sugar, then cook slowly until soft and caramelized.
Heat olive oil in a large saute pan over high heat.
Add the mushrooms and saute until golden brown and cooked down.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Preheat grill.
Flatten the dough, brush liberally with olive oil, and place on the grill.
Grill on one side until golden brown.
Turn over the dough and spread with mozzarella, onions, mushrooms, and blue cheese.

original_instructions:
In medium bowl stir together cheese, ham, green onions and flour. Add mayonnaise, mustard and caraway seeds. Mix until combined. Spread in 9-inch pie plate.
Bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees F about 25 minutes or until heated through and bubbly around edges.
Serve warm with Keebler Town House Flipsides Original Crackers.
- or - .
ingredients: 56 Keebler Town House Flipsides Original Crackers
56 Keebler Town House Flipsides Cheddar Crackers
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
In a medium bowl, stir together shredded cheese, chopped ham, sliced green onions, and flour.
Add mayonnaise, mustard, and caraway seeds to the mixture.
Mix until combined.
Spread the mixture in a 9-inch pie plate.
Bake, uncovered, in the oven for about 25 minutes or until heated through and bubbly around the edges.
Serve warm with crackers.

original_instructions: In a blender combine ginger, yogurt, orange juice and the frozen peaches. Blend until smooth.
ingredients: 1 (1-inch) piece fresh ginger, peeled and grated
step_by_step_instructions: Peel and grate the fresh ginger.
In a blender, combine the grated ginger, plain yogurt, orange juice, and sliced frozen peaches.
Blend the mixture until it is smooth.

original_instructions:
Special equipment: 8 wooden skewers that have been soaked in water or 8 metal skewers
Mix the butter, brown sugar, chili powder, cumin, orange zest, 1 tablespoon salt, and 1 teaspoon pepper together in a bowl. Add the beef, toss to coat evenly. Cover and refrigerate for 15 minutes or up to 1 hour.
Preheat a grill over high heat. Thread the beef, onions, and peppers onto 8 long skewers leaving 1/4-inch space between the meat and vegetables. Lightly brush the grill grates with oil. Arrange the skewers on the hot grill and grill, turning until the meat is medium-rare, about 2 to 3 minutes on each of the 4 sides. Transfer the kebabs to the platter and serve.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
1 1/2 pounds beef tri-tip, cut into 1 1/2-inch cubes
1 large sweet onion, cut into 1 1/2 to 2-inch dice
12 assorted color baby bell peppers, cored and halved
step_by_step_instructions: Soak 8 wooden skewers in water, or use 8 metal skewers.
Mix melted butter, brown sugar, chili powder, cumin, orange zest, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Add the beef cubes to the mixture and toss to coat evenly.
Cover the bowl and refrigerate for 15 minutes to 1 hour.
Preheat a grill over high heat.
Thread the beef cubes, diced onion, and halved bell peppers onto the skewers, leaving space between the meat and vegetables.
Lightly brush the grill grates with oil.
Arrange the skewers on the hot grill.
Grill the kebabs, turning them to cook each of the 4 sides for about 2 to 3 minutes, until the meat is medium-rare.
Transfer the grilled kebabs to a platter and serve.

original_instructions:
Put the chicken in a medium pot with just enough water to cover; add 1 tablespoon salt. Bring to a gentle simmer over medium heat and cook until the chicken is firm to the touch, about 15 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare a bowl of salted ice water. Drain the chicken and plunge into the ice water for about 30 seconds to stop the cooking. Drain again. Grate the ginger and shallot into a small bowl. Stir in 3 tablespoons peanut oil, the sesame oil and 1/4 teaspoon each sugar and salt. Toss the cucumber and radishes with the chili sauce, 3/4 teaspoon salt, the remaining 1 tablespoon peanut oil and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon sugar in a large bowl. Add the watercress and toss. Divide the salad among plates. Slice the chicken and add to the plates, then top with the ginger mixture. Drizzle with the lime juice.
Photograph by Antonis Achilleos
ingredients: 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts (1 3/4 to 2 pounds)
1 English cucumber, halved lengthwise, seeded and thinly sliced
1 bunch radishes, thinly sliced, or 1 small daikon radish, peeled and cut into matchsticks
1 teaspoon Asian chili sauce (such as sambal oelek)
step_by_step_instructions: Put the chicken in a medium pot with just enough water to cover; add 1 tablespoon salt.
Bring to a gentle simmer over medium heat and cook until the chicken is firm to the touch, about 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, prepare a bowl of salted ice water.
Drain the chicken and plunge into the ice water for about 30 seconds to stop the cooking.
Drain again.
Grate the ginger and shallot into a small bowl.
Stir in 3 tablespoons peanut oil, the sesame oil and 1/4 teaspoon each sugar and salt.
Toss the cucumber and radishes with the chili sauce, 3/4 teaspoon salt, the remaining 1 tablespoon peanut oil and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon sugar in a large bowl.
Add the watercress and toss.
Divide the salad among plates.
Slice the chicken and add to the plates, then top with the ginger mixture.
Drizzle with the lime juice.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat grill to medium.
In a small saucepan add butter, brown sugar, apple cider, cinnamon, ginger, and salt. Place onto grill until butter melts. Mix together until well combined.
Place pears directly onto grill for 2 to 4 minutes. Turn and cook on the other side. Brush both sides of the pears with the butter mixture to glaze. Immediately take pears off the grill after glazing and place on a plate.
Scoop ice cream into 4 serving bowls. Top with pears, pecans and whipped cream. Drizzle the remaining butter mixture on top and serve.
ingredients: 2 pears, stemmed, cored, and sliced lengthwise 1/2 inch thick
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the grill to medium.
In a small saucepan, add butter, brown sugar, apple cider, cinnamon, ginger, and salt.
Place the saucepan onto the grill until the butter melts.
Mix together until well combined.
Place pears directly onto the grill for 2 to 4 minutes.
Turn and cook on the other side.
Brush both sides of the pears with the butter mixture to glaze.
Immediately take the pears off the grill after glazing and place them on a plate.
Scoop ice cream into 4 serving bowls.
Top with pears, pecans, and whipped cream.
Drizzle the remaining butter mixture on top and serve.

original_instructions:
Preheat a grill to medium high. Soak 8 wooden skewers in water, about 15 minutes. Meanwhile, make the dressing: Mix the olive oil, vinegar, oregano, shallot, garlic, red pepper flakes and 1 1/4 teaspoons salt in a large bowl. Drizzle the cut sides of each piece of romaine with about 1 teaspoon of the dressing. Add the chicken to the bowl with the remaining dressing and toss. Add the breadcrumbs and toss to coat. Thread the chicken onto the skewers, leaving space between each piece. Grill the chicken skewers, turning occasionally, until cooked through, 8 to 10 minutes. Meanwhile, grill the romaine, turning once, until marked and slightly wilted, 1 to 2 minutes. Transfer the romaine to plates and drizzle with olive oil and vinegar. Season with salt. Serve with the chicken skewers and sprinkle with the parmesan.
Photograph by Antonis Achilleos
ingredients: 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling
2 teaspoons red wine vinegar, plus more for drizzling
1 tablespoon minced shallot or red onion
1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breasts or thighs, cut into chunks
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat a grill to medium high.
Soak 8 wooden skewers in water for about 15 minutes.
In a large bowl, mix olive oil, vinegar, oregano, shallot, garlic, red pepper flakes, and 1 1/4 teaspoons salt to make the dressing.
Drizzle the cut sides of each piece of romaine with about 1 teaspoon of the dressing.
Add the chicken to the bowl with the remaining dressing and toss to coat.
Add the breadcrumbs to the chicken and toss to coat.
Thread the chicken onto the skewers, leaving space between each piece.
Grill the chicken skewers, turning occasionally, until cooked through, about 8 to 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, grill the romaine, turning once, until marked and slightly wilted, about 1 to 2 minutes.
Transfer the romaine to plates and drizzle with olive oil and vinegar.
Season the romaine with salt.
Serve the romaine with the chicken skewers and sprinkle with parmesan.

original_instructions:
Soak the beans overnight in cold water to cover.
Drain the beans and transfer them to a large saucepan. Cover with 3 cups cold water, the coconut water and 2 teaspoons salt, set over medium heat and bring to a boil. Boil for 2 minutes, then turn the heat down to low, cover and cook until tender; depending upon the age of the beans, this will take between 30 and 45 minutes (older beans take longer).
When tender, add the coconut oil and lime juice and season with salt and pepper. Pour into a serving dish and garnish with the green onions.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Soak the beans overnight in cold water to cover.
Drain the beans and transfer them to a large saucepan.
Cover with 3 cups cold water, the coconut water, and 2 teaspoons salt.
Set over medium heat and bring to a boil.
Boil for 2 minutes, then turn the heat down to low, cover and cook until tender, about 30 to 45 minutes.
When tender, add the coconut oil and lime juice and season with salt and pepper.
Pour into a serving dish and garnish with the green onions.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine olive oil and all spices in a large bowl. Add pita wedges and toss to coat, Spread in 1 layer on a baking sheet and bake for 25 to 30 minutes, tossing once, until pita is brown and crisp. Cool completely before serving.
ingredients: 3 whole-wheat pita breads, cut into eighths
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Combine olive oil and all spices in a large bowl.
Add pita wedges and toss to coat.
Spread in 1 layer on a baking sheet.
Bake for 25 to 30 minutes, tossing once, until pita is brown and crisp.
Cool completely before serving.

original_instructions: Place chocolate in a double boiler on the stove. When melted, add the cream and stir until soupy. Remove from the heat and serve in a fondue pot with a low flame or preheated ceramic dish. Serve with berries and other fruit.
ingredients: 1 pound chocolate, milk, dark or semisweet
step_by_step_instructions: Place chocolate in a double boiler on the stove.
When melted, add the cream and stir until soupy.
Remove from the heat and serve in a fondue pot with a low flame or preheated ceramic dish.
Serve with berries and other fruit.

original_instructions:
Combine the lime juice, celery seed, and horseradish in a pitcher. Muddle the mixture with the end of a wooden spoon to blend and break up the celery seeds. Pour in the tomato juice, hot sauce, and Worcestershire sauce; season with salt and pepper. Stir everything together to combine.
Divide the vodka among 6 tall, chilled glasses filled with ice. Fill the glasses with the Bloody Mary mix, stick in the celery and cucumber and garnish with the cilantro. Give the Bloody Mary a good stir and serve.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons grated fresh or prepared horseradish
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 1/2 cups pepper vodka, chilled in the freezer
step_by_step_instructions: Squeeze the juice from 6 limes into a pitcher.
Add 1 tablespoon of celery seeds to the pitcher.
Add 3 tablespoons of grated horseradish to the pitcher.
Using the end of a wooden spoon, muddle the mixture to blend and break up the celery seeds.
Pour 2 quarts of chilled tomato juice into the pitcher.
Add 2 tablespoons of hot sauce to the pitcher.
Add 1 tablespoon of Worcestershire sauce to the pitcher.
Season the mixture with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Stir all the ingredients together in the pitcher to combine.
Divide 1 1/2 cups of chilled pepper vodka among 6 tall, chilled glasses filled with ice.
Fill the glasses with the Bloody Mary mix from the pitcher.
Insert a celery stalk and a cucumber spear into each glass.
Garnish each glass with a handful of fresh cilantro.
Stir each Bloody Mary well before serving.

original_instructions:
Chimichurri: Combine garlic, aji, and salt in a mortar. Add vinegar, water, and drizzle in oil.
Steak: Marinate steak in all but 1 tablespoon chimichurri for about 1 hour, covered and refrigerated.
In a large pot, cover beans with water and cook with bacon and onion, without salt. Allow to simmer until tender, about 1 1/2 hours. Strain the beans, reserving the cooking liquid. Remove and discard the bacon and onion. Put back the cooking liquid on the stove, allow to boil until cooking liquid is starchy and thick. Reserve 1 cup.
Grill steak until medium rare, about 2 to 3 minutes on each side.
Slice steak into 2-inch pieces. Mix into the beans add all the other ingredients, including the reserved chimichurri and reduced cooking liquid. Season and serve at room temperature.
ingredients: 1 red pepper, roasted, peeled, and cut into julienne
1 yellow pepper, roasted, peeled, and cut into julienne
2 (1 1/2 pound) skirt steaks, cleaned of silver skin
2 cups dry white beans, allow to soak in water 24 hours before cooking
step_by_step_instructions: Combine garlic, aji, and salt in a mortar.
Add vinegar, water, and drizzle in oil to the mortar.
Marinate steak in all but 1 tablespoon of the chimichurri for about 1 hour, covered and refrigerated.
In a large pot, cover beans with water and cook with bacon and onion, without salt.
Allow to simmer until beans are tender, about 1.5 hours.
Strain the beans, reserving the cooking liquid.
Remove and discard the bacon and onion.
Put back the cooking liquid on the stove and boil until starchy and thick.
Reserve 1 cup of the reduced cooking liquid.
Grill steak until medium rare, about 2 to 3 minutes on each side.
Slice steak into 2-inch pieces.
Mix sliced steak into the beans.
Add remaining ingredients including reserved chimichurri and reduced cooking liquid.
Season and serve at room temperature.

original_instructions:
Put the cream cheese and heavy cream in a small mixing bowl and blend with a rubber spatula until smooth. Fold in the dill, lemon zest, salt and pepper until evenly combined.
Using a butter knife or offset spatula, spread the dill cream cheese on 1 side of each pumpernickel slice. Put a slice of smoked salmon on 12 of the pumpernickel slices. Top each sandwich with remaining bread. Arrange on a serving platter and serve immediately.
Copyright 2009, Television Food Network, G.P., All Rights Reserved
ingredients: 8 ounces cream cheese, softened to room temperature
6 slices ( about 4 ounces) smoked salmon, halved
step_by_step_instructions: Put the cream cheese and heavy cream in a small mixing bowl and blend with a rubber spatula until smooth.
Fold in the dill, lemon zest, salt, and pepper until evenly combined.
Using a butter knife or offset spatula, spread the dill cream cheese on one side of each pumpernickel slice.
Put a slice of smoked salmon on 12 of the pumpernickel slices.
Top each sandwich with the remaining bread.
Arrange on a serving platter and serve immediately.

original_instructions: Into 6 large mugs pour equal amounts of coffee and milk and garnish each serving with cinnamon sticks.;
step_by_step_instructions: Pour equal amounts of coffee and milk into 6 large mugs.
Garnish each serving with a cinnamon stick.

recipe_title: Sauteed Brussels Sprouts and Red Cabbage
original_instructions:
Prepare a large bowl of ice water. Set aside.
Trim the Brussels sprouts and peel off 1 outer layer of leaves. Cut the sprouts in half lengthwise, larger sprouts can be quartered. Place the sprouts in a large saucepan, cover with cold water and add about 2 tablespoons of salt. Bring the sprouts to a boil and drain immediately. Transfer the sprouts to the bowl of ice water. (This will stop the cooking and preserve their color.) Drain well.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat, add the butter. When the butter is melted, add the Brussels sprouts. Cook for 1 minute then add the sliced cabbage. Cook until the cabbage has softened and the sprouts are warmed through. Season with salt and pepper and serve warm.
ingredients: 1 small red cabbage or 1/2 large cabbage, finely sliced
Coarse salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Prepare a large bowl of ice water and set aside.
Trim the Brussels sprouts and peel off one outer layer of leaves.
Cut the sprouts in half lengthwise; larger sprouts can be quartered.
Place the sprouts in a large saucepan, cover with cold water and add about 2 tablespoons of salt.
Bring the sprouts to a boil and drain immediately.
Transfer the sprouts to the bowl of ice water to stop cooking and preserve their color.
Drain the sprouts well.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and add the butter.
When the butter is melted, add the Brussels sprouts.
Cook for 1 minute then add the sliced cabbage.
Cook until the cabbage has softened and the sprouts are warmed through.
Season with salt and pepper and serve warm.

original_instructions:
Place 2 Champagne flutes into the freezer to chill for 10 minutes.
Remove the glasses from the freezer.
To each glass add: 1 tablespoon pomegranate seeds, 4 ounces Champagne, 1 ounce pear juice, and 1 ounce pomegranate juice.
step_by_step_instructions: Place 2 Champagne flutes into the freezer to chill for 10 minutes.
Remove the glasses from the freezer.
To each glass add: 1 tablespoon pomegranate seeds, 4 ounces Champagne, 1 ounce pear juice, and 1 ounce pomegranate juice.

original_instructions: Combine sugar and water and allow to dissolve. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Serve cold or over ice.
step_by_step_instructions: Combine sugar and water and allow to dissolve.
Add lime juice, orange juice, and lemon juice.
Mix well.
Serve cold or over ice.

recipe_title: Arugula and Romaine Salad with Walnuts and Blue Cheese Vinaigrette
original_instructions:
Chill salad plates when you begin preparing your entree.
When your entree is almost ready to serve, combine arugula and romaine leaves and separate onto 4 chilled salad plates. Scatter toasted walnuts evenly among the salads. Pour vinegar into a small bowl and whisk in extra-virgin olive oil in a slow stream to combine dressing. Season dressing with salt and pepper, then stir in blue cheese crumbles. Ladle dressing evenly over top of salad plates and serve.
ingredients: 2 cups arugula leaves, washed and trimmed
1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil, eyeball it
step_by_step_instructions: Chill salad plates when you begin preparing your entree.
When your entree is almost ready to serve, combine arugula and romaine leaves.
Separate the mixed leaves onto 4 chilled salad plates.
Scatter toasted walnuts evenly among the salads.
Pour vinegar into a small bowl and whisk in extra-virgin olive oil in a slow stream to combine dressing.
Season dressing with salt and pepper.
Stir in blue cheese crumbles into the dressing.
Ladle dressing evenly over top of salad plates and serve.

original_instructions:
Set a rimmed baking sheet on an oven rack and preheat to 425 degrees F.
Add the broccoli, oil, garlic, shallots, 3/4 teaspoon salt and red pepper flakes to a large bowl and toss to coat. Transfer to the preheated baking sheet and spread out in a single layer. Roast until the broccoli florets are browned on the ends, the stalks are crisp-tender and the shallots are caramelized, about 20 minutes, tossing about halfway through. Immediately sprinkle with the Asiago and lemon zest. Season with some salt if needed. Transfer to a serving platter.
ingredients: 8 cups broccoli florets (2 to 3 large heads)
1/8 to 1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
1/4 cup finely shredded aged Asiago cheese
step_by_step_instructions: Set a rimmed baking sheet on an oven rack and preheat to 425 degrees F.
Add the broccoli, oil, garlic, shallots, 3/4 teaspoon salt and red pepper flakes to a large bowl and toss to coat.
Transfer to the preheated baking sheet and spread out in a single layer.
Roast until the broccoli florets are browned on the ends, the stalks are crisp-tender, and the shallots are caramelized, about 20 minutes, tossing about halfway through.
Immediately sprinkle with the Asiago and lemon zest.
Season with some salt if needed.
Transfer to a serving platter.

original_instructions:
Simmer onion, carrot, and celery in broth and water with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a medium saucepan, covered, until tender, about 6 minutes. Add peas and simmer, uncovered, until bright green and tender, about 3 minutes. Stir in pesto, then purée soup in 2 batches in a blender until smooth (use caution when blending hot liquids). Season with salt.
Simmer onion, carrot, and celery in broth and water with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a medium saucepan, covered, until tender, about 6 minutes. Add peas and simmer, uncovered, until bright green and tender, about 3 minutes. Stir in pesto, then purée soup in 2 batches in a blender until smooth (use caution when blending hot liquids). Season with salt.
ingredients: 1/4 cup store-bought basil pesto plus additional for serving
step_by_step_instructions: Simmer onion, carrot, and celery in broth and water with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a medium saucepan, covered, until tender, about 6 minutes.
Add peas and simmer, uncovered, until bright green and tender, about 3 minutes.
Stir in pesto.
Purée soup in 2 batches in a blender until smooth, using caution when blending hot liquids.
Season with salt.

original_instructions: Cream butter and sugar. Add milk and egg and beat until smooth. Sift together flour, baking powder and salt. Add to creamed mixture. Mix until moistened. Toss blueberries with flour and fold into batter. Fill a well-greased muffin pan 2/3 full with the batter. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes.;
step_by_step_instructions: Cream butter and sugar together in a bowl.
Add milk and egg to the mixture and beat until smooth.
In a separate bowl, sift together flour, baking powder, and salt.
Add the dry ingredients to the creamed mixture and mix until moistened.
Toss blueberries with a tablespoon of flour.
Fold the floured blueberries into the batter.
Fill a well-greased muffin pan 2/3 full with the batter.
Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Combine all the vegetables, garlic, and rosemary in a large mixing bowl. Sprinkle on the salt, pepper, and 1/3 cup olive oil and toss to coat thoroughly. (The vegetables may be prepared to this point up to 4 hours in advance.)
Drop the vegetables into a shallow 2 1/2 quart ovenproof casserole and press them down evenly. Bake 45 minutes.
To make the topping, break up the bread and make coarse crumbs in a food processor. Scrape them into a small bowl and drizzle on the 1 tablespoon olive oil. Use your fingers to rub the oil evenly into the crumbs.
Remove the tian from the oven. Sprinkle the crumbs all over the top. Return the dish to the oven and bake 15 more minutes, or until the vegetables are very tender. Let sit 10 minutes before serving.
ingredients: 1 red onion, cut vertically into sixths, sections separated
1 green bell pepper, cut into 1 1/2inch chunks
12 ounces mushrooms, large ones quartered, medium ones halved
2 plum tomatoes, cored and cut into sixths
3 mediumlarge sweet potatoes or yams, peeled, quartered lengthwise, and sliced 1/4inch thick
2 teaspoons chopped fresh rosemary, or 3/4 teaspoon crumbled dried
Generous seasoning freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
Combine all the vegetables, garlic, and rosemary in a large mixing bowl.
Sprinkle on the salt, pepper, and 1/3 cup olive oil and toss to coat thoroughly.
Drop the vegetables into a shallow 2 1/2 quart ovenproof casserole and press them down evenly.
Bake for 45 minutes.
To make the topping, break up the bread and make coarse crumbs in a food processor.
Scrape the crumbs into a small bowl and drizzle on the 1 tablespoon olive oil.
Use your fingers to rub the oil evenly into the crumbs.
Remove the tian from the oven.
Sprinkle the crumbs all over the top.
Return the dish to the oven and bake for 15 more minutes, or until the vegetables are very tender.
Let sit for 10 minutes before serving.

original_instructions:
Combine the flour, salt, and sugar in food processor. Add butter; process until mixture resembles coarse meal, about 8 to 10 seconds. For hand method, place dry ingredients in large bowl. Add butter; blend with pastry cutter until mixture resembles coarse meal.
Add ice water in a slow steady stream through feed tube of food processor with machine running, until the dough holds together for no longer than 30 seconds. For hand method, mix dough with a wooden spoon, adding water until dough just holds together.
Turn dough onto piece of plastic wrap. Press into a disk, and. wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate at least 1 hour. May be frozen, double wrapped in plastic, for several months.
ingredients: 1 cup (2 sticks) cold unsalted butter, cut into small pieces
step_by_step_instructions: Combine the flour, salt, and sugar in a food processor.
Add butter to the processor and process until the mixture resembles coarse meal, about 8 to 10 seconds.
If using the hand method, place dry ingredients in a large bowl, add butter, and blend with a pastry cutter until the mixture resembles coarse meal.
Add ice water in a slow steady stream through the feed tube of the processor with the machine running, until the dough holds together for no longer than 30 seconds.
For hand method, mix dough with a wooden spoon, adding water until dough just holds together.
Turn dough onto a piece of plastic wrap.
Press dough into a disk and wrap in plastic wrap.
Refrigerate the dough for at least 1 hour.
The dough may be frozen, double wrapped in plastic, for several months.

original_instructions:
Bring water to a boil in a heavy medium saucepan. Add rice and 1/4 teaspoon salt, then reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered, until rice is tender, about 40 minutes. Drain in a sieve. Heat butter in a large heavy skillet over medium heat until foam subsides. Add nuts and cook, stirring, until butter and nuts are golden brown, about 4 minutes. Add rice and nutmeg to skillet and toss to coat.
Bring water to a boil in a heavy medium saucepan. Add rice and 1/4 teaspoon salt, then reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered, until rice is tender, about 40 minutes. Drain in a sieve.
Heat butter in a large heavy skillet over medium heat until foam subsides. Add nuts and cook, stirring, until butter and nuts are golden brown, about 4 minutes.
Add rice and nutmeg to skillet and toss to coat.
step_by_step_instructions: Bring 4 cups of water to a boil in a heavy medium saucepan.
Add 1 1/2 cups of short-grain brown rice and 1/4 teaspoon of salt to the boiling water.
Reduce heat to low and simmer the rice, uncovered, until tender, about 40 minutes.
Drain the cooked rice in a sieve.
Heat 3 tablespoons of butter in a large heavy skillet over medium heat until the foam subsides.
Add 1 1/4 cups of chopped nuts and cook, stirring, until butter and nuts are golden brown, about 4 minutes.
Add the drained rice and 1/4 teaspoon of grated nutmeg to the skillet.
Toss everything to coat the rice with the nut mixture.

recipe_title: Sweet Potato Gratin with Smoked Chiles
original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Combine the heavy cream and chipotle puree in a small bowl. In an 8 by 8-inch baking dish, arrange a fourth of the sweet potatoes. Season to taste with salt and pepper and pour a fourth of the cream over it. Repeat with the remaining potatoes and cream, forming 4 layers.
Bake for 1 hour or until the cream has been absorbed and the potatoes are browned. Remove from the oven and let sit 10 minutes before serving.
ingredients: 3 medium sweet potatoes, peeled and sliced thin
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Combine the heavy cream and chipotle puree in a small bowl.
In an 8 by 8-inch baking dish, arrange a fourth of the sweet potatoes.
Season to taste with salt and pepper and pour a fourth of the cream over it.
Repeat with the remaining potatoes and cream, forming 4 layers.
Bake for 1 hour or until the cream has been absorbed and the potatoes are browned.
Remove from the oven and let sit 10 minutes before serving.

original_instructions:
Stir together cornstarch and 1/4 cup water until smooth. Bring broth and remaining 3/4 cup water to a boil in a 2- to 3-quart heavy saucepan over high heat, then reduce heat to moderately high and add zest and salt. Stir cornstarch mixture and add to soup, whisking until smooth. Simmer, whisking, 2 minutes, then add egg in a slow stream, stirring with a spoon. Stir in spinach and return to a boil, then remove from heat. Season with salt.
Stir together cornstarch and 1/4 cup water until smooth.
Bring broth and remaining 3/4 cup water to a boil in a 2- to 3-quart heavy saucepan over high heat, then reduce heat to moderately high and add zest and salt.
Stir cornstarch mixture and add to soup, whisking until smooth. Simmer, whisking, 2 minutes, then add egg in a slow stream, stirring with a spoon. Stir in spinach and return to a boil, then remove from heat. Season with salt.
ingredients: 3 cups low-sodium low-fat chicken broth (24 fl oz)
2 teaspoons finely grated fresh lemon zest
1 cup firmly packed shredded spinach leaves
step_by_step_instructions: Stir together cornstarch and 1/4 cup water until smooth.
Bring broth and remaining 3/4 cup water to a boil in a 2- to 3-quart heavy saucepan over high heat.
Reduce heat to moderately high and add zest and salt.
Stir cornstarch mixture and add to soup, whisking until smooth.
Simmer, whisking, 2 minutes.
Add egg in a slow stream, stirring with a spoon.
Stir in spinach and return to a boil.
Remove from heat.
Season with salt.

recipe_title: Roasted Rainbow Trout with Rock Shrimp and Sage Butter Stuffing
original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees.
Well in advance of cooking the fish, prepare the stuffing. Combine the sage, softened butter, lemon juice, spice and seasonings, bread crumbs, pine nuts, jalapenos, garlic and coriander in the bowl of a food processor, pulsing to combine well. Remove and place in a bowl. Keep refrigerated until ready to use.
Season the trout with salt and pepper and rub the trout with olive oil.
Divide the stuffing between the 4 fish evenly and spread an even layer inside the cavity of the fish. Divide the shrimp in the same way and add the shrimp in a layer in top of the herb butter. Close the fish to seal in the stuffing.
Lay the fish on an oiled rack and set in a roasting pan.
Place the fish in the oven and roast for 12 minutes on each side. Remove and serve immediately.
ingredients: 1/4 cup unsalted butter, softened to room temperature
2 fresh jalapeno peppers, seeded and diced
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
4 butterflied rainbow trout, whole, skin on, bones removed (ask your fish dealer to do this for you)
1/2 pound cleaned and shelled rock shrimp
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees.
Prepare the stuffing by combining sage, butter, lemon juice, salt, pepper, paprika, scallions, bread crumbs, pine nuts, jalapenos, garlic, and coriander in a food processor and pulse to combine.
Remove the stuffing from the processor, place it in a bowl, and refrigerate until ready to use.
Season the trout with salt and pepper and rub with olive oil.
Divide the stuffing evenly among the 4 fish and spread it inside the cavity of each fish.
Divide the shrimp evenly and layer on top of the stuffing.
Close the fish to seal in the stuffing.
Oil a rack and lay the fish on it, then place the rack in a roasting pan.
Roast the fish in the oven for 12 minutes on each side.
Remove the fish from the oven and serve immediately.

original_instructions:
Trim the fat of the flank steak and cut into thin pieces against the grain. Marinate the meat for 1 hour in a mix of egg, cornstarch, and 2 tablespoons oil.
In large wok, cook the rice noodles in 2 inches of hot oil for just a few seconds, or until they puff up. Drain the noodles and set to the side. Heat up the wok again with 3 cups of oil to 350 degrees F and add the cut up flank steak. Stir for 3 to 4 minutes, and then remove from the heat and drain well.
Heat the wok up again and add 2 teaspoons oil, ground garlic, all the cut up scallions, and the marinated beef. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Now add the sugar, black pepper, and soy sauce and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from the heat and serve over the rice noodles.
ingredients: 3 cups plus 2 tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons vegetable oil, plus more for frying
3/4 cup (3/4-inch long) scallion slices, green and white parts
step_by_step_instructions: Trim the fat from the flank steak.
Cut the flank steak into thin pieces against the grain.
Marinate the meat for 1 hour in a mix of egg, cornstarch, and 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil.
In a large wok, heat 2 inches of vegetable oil until hot.
Cook the rice noodles in the hot oil for just a few seconds until they puff up.
Drain the noodles and set them to the side.
Heat up the wok again with 3 cups of oil to 350 degrees F.
Add the cut up flank steak and stir for 3 to 4 minutes.
Remove the steak from the heat and drain well.
Heat the wok and add 2 teaspoons of oil, ground garlic, scallions, and the marinated beef.
Cook for 2 to 3 minutes.
Add sugar, black pepper, and soy sauce, and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes.
Remove from heat and serve the beef over the rice noodles.

original_instructions: Combine parsley, garlic, lime juice, and extra virgin olive oil and set aside. This is your mojo sauce. In a large pot with oil heated to at least 350 degrees, fry yuca until golden brown season with salt and pepper when hot. Serve yuca with the mojo sauce on top.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil
2 pound blanched Yuca, cut into steak fry size
step_by_step_instructions: Combine the parsley, garlic, lime juice, and extra virgin olive oil in a bowl to make the mojo sauce. Set aside.
Heat oil in a large pot to at least 350 degrees.
Fry the yuca in the hot oil until golden brown.
Season the fried yuca with salt and pepper while it's hot.
Serve the yuca with the prepared mojo sauce on top.

original_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. 2. In a 9x13 glass baking dish, whisk together the balsamic vinegar, honey, soy sauce, and minced garlic. 3. Place the chicken breasts on top of the mixture and turn to coat. 4. Bake, uncovered, for 30–40 minutes, depending on the size of the chicken breasts, until cooked through. Baste the chicken with the sauce half way through cooking.
1. Preheat oven to 350°F.
2. In a 9x13 glass baking dish, whisk together the balsamic vinegar, honey, soy sauce, and minced garlic.
3. Place the chicken breasts on top of the mixture and turn to coat.
4. Bake, uncovered, for 30–40 minutes, depending on the size of the chicken breasts, until cooked through. Baste the chicken with the sauce half way through cooking.
Do Ahead The chicken can be marinated up to 8 hours.
The chicken can be marinated up to 8 hours.
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a 9x13 glass baking dish, whisk together the balsamic vinegar, honey, soy sauce, and minced garlic.
Place the chicken breasts on top of the mixture and turn to coat.
Bake, uncovered, for 30–40 minutes, depending on the size of the chicken breasts, until cooked through.
Baste the chicken with the sauce halfway through cooking.

original_instructions:
Spread all of the bread slices generously with the ginger butter. Place slices of smoked salmon in an even layer on half of the bread slices. Top with remaining bread slices. Using a 2-inch flower-shaped cookie cutter, cut out the tea sandwiches. Remove the top slice of bread from each flower. Using a 3/4 to 7/8-inch round biscuit cutter, cut a circle from the center of each, discard the circle. Replace the slice, butter-side down, on the flower.
Place butter, cream cheese, ginger, lime juice, cilantro and salt in the bowl of a food processor. Pulse just until ingredients are combined, about 30 seconds.
Transfer mixture to a sheet of parchment or waxed paper. Roll into a 1 1/2-inch wide log. Refrigerate until ready to use.
ingredients: 4 ounces Ginger-Cilantro Lime Butter, recipe follows
8 tablespoons (1 stick) unsalted butter, at room temperature
2 ounces (1/4 cup) cream cheese, at room temperature
step_by_step_instructions: Spread all of the bread slices generously with the ginger butter.
Place slices of smoked salmon in an even layer on half of the bread slices.
Top with remaining bread slices.
Using a 2-inch flower-shaped cookie cutter, cut out the tea sandwiches.
Remove the top slice of bread from each flower.
Using a 3/4 to 7/8-inch round biscuit cutter, cut a circle from the center of each, discard the circle.
Replace the slice, butter-side down, on the flower.
Place butter, cream cheese, ginger, lime juice, cilantro and salt in the bowl of a food processor.
Pulse just until ingredients are combined, about 30 seconds.
Transfer mixture to a sheet of parchment or waxed paper.
Roll into a 1 1/2-inch wide log.
Refrigerate until ready to use.

original_instructions:
Slice eggs in half crosswise. Separate the whites from the yolks. Slice the egg whites into ringlets and set aside.
In a bowl, whisk together the yolks and cold water until the yolks are dissolved. Whisk in the oil, salt, sugar, and mustard until combined well. Add the vinegars.
Toss the greens with the dressing. Transfer to a serving bowl. Place scallions around the outside and top with the egg white ringlets.
ingredients: 1 pound mixed greens (lettuce, chervil, watercress, etc.)
1 cup scallions, sliced on the diagonal
step_by_step_instructions: Slice eggs in half crosswise.
Separate the whites from the yolks.
Slice the egg whites into ringlets and set aside.
In a bowl, whisk together the yolks and cold water until the yolks are dissolved.
Whisk in the oil, salt, sugar, and mustard until combined well.
Add the vinegars to the mixture.
Toss the greens with the dressing.
Transfer to a serving bowl.
Place scallions around the outside and top with the egg white ringlets.

recipe_title: Grilled Red Onions with Balsamic Vinegar
original_instructions: Heat a clean griddle and brush with 1/2 of the oil. Brush onion slices lightly with remaining oil on both sides, season with salt and pepper and place on griddle. Grill for 3 to 5 minutes on each side, or until softened and lightly charred. Transfer onions to a bowl, drizzle with vinegar and sprinkle with rosemary. Toss to separate rings and season with more salt and pepper as needed.
ingredients: 2 pounds red onions, cut crosswise into 1/2inch thick slices
step_by_step_instructions: Heat a clean griddle and brush with 1/2 of the olive oil.
Brush onion slices lightly with the remaining olive oil on both sides.
Season onion slices with salt and pepper.
Place onion slices on the griddle.
Grill for 3 to 5 minutes on each side, or until softened and lightly charred.
Transfer onions to a bowl.
Drizzle onions with balsamic vinegar.
Sprinkle onions with chopped rosemary.
Toss to separate onion rings.
Season with more salt and pepper as needed.

original_instructions: In a saucepan on medium-high heat, add the butter, chicken stock and thyme. Simmer until the thyme wilts slightly, about 8 minutes. Add the corn and stir to break up any chunks. Simmer for about 10 minutes. Remove from the heat, remove the sprigs of thyme, add the sour cream and season with salt and pepper. Stir to blend, and then serve with a dash of cayenne pepper.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Heat a saucepan on medium-high heat.
Add the butter, chicken stock, and thyme to the saucepan.
Simmer the mixture until the thyme wilts slightly, about 8 minutes.
Add the corn to the saucepan and stir to break up any chunks.
Continue to simmer for about 10 minutes.
Remove the saucepan from heat.
Remove the sprigs of thyme.
Add the sour cream to the mixture.
Season with salt and pepper.
Stir to blend everything together.
Serve with a dash of cayenne pepper.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly coat a baking sheet with canola oil.
In a large mixing bowl, cream butter, cream cheese, and brown sugar on low speed with an electric mixer. Add egg yolks and vanilla and mix on low until just combined.
In a medium bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Add to butter mixture and mix by hand until combined. Portion heaping teaspoonfuls (or use a 3/4 ounce scoop) onto baking sheet about 1 1/2 inches apart. Bake for 7 minutes. Lightly flatten cookies with finger. Rotate baking sheet and bake an additional 3 minutes.
ingredients: 1 package semi-sweet chocolate chips, about 6 ounces
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Lightly coat a baking sheet with canola oil.
In a large mixing bowl, cream butter, cream cheese, and brown sugar on low speed with an electric mixer.
Add egg yolks and vanilla extract and mix on low until just combined.
In a medium bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, whole-wheat flour, baking soda, salt, and chocolate chips.
Add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture and mix by hand until combined.
Portion heaping teaspoonfuls onto the baking sheet about 1 1/2 inches apart.
Bake for 7 minutes.
Lightly flatten cookies with finger.
Rotate baking sheet and bake an additional 3 minutes.

original_instructions:
Place the chocolate chips in a blender. Crack in the eggs, and then add the orange liqueur and salt. Pulse until the chocolate chips are partially pulverized, 5 to 7 times.
With the blender running, carefully pour in the coffee in a steady stream through the small opening in the lid. The coffee will melt the chocolate and turn it into a smooth mixture. Turn off the blender when the mixture is very smooth. Pour the mixture into small mason jars, pretty wine glasses or demitasse cups.
Place the jars on a tray and refrigerate them until firm, at least 2 or 3 hours. Yum!
Whip the cream with the sugar and generously plop it onto the top of each glass. Cut a strip of orange peel, cut into strips and decorate with the orange peel twists.
ingredients: 2 to 3 teaspoons orange liqueur, such as Grand Marnier
step_by_step_instructions: Place the chocolate chips in a blender.
Crack the eggs into the blender.
Add the orange liqueur and salt to the blender.
Pulse the blender 5 to 7 times until the chocolate chips are partially pulverized.
With the blender running, carefully pour in the coffee in a steady stream through the small opening in the lid.
Continue blending until the mixture is very smooth.
Turn off the blender and pour the mixture into small mason jars, wine glasses, or demitasse cups.
Place the jars on a tray and refrigerate them until firm, for at least 2 to 3 hours.
Whip the cream with the sugar.
Generously plop the whipped cream onto the top of each glass.
Cut a strip of orange peel, slice it into strips, and decorate the glasses with the orange peel twists.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
For the cake: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9-by-13-inch baking pan with butter.
Add the flour, baking powder, cinnamon and salt to a medium bowl and stir to combine. Set aside.
Cream together the butter and sugar with an electric mixer. Add the egg and mix until combined. Mix in the vanilla. Add the flour mixture and milk alternately and mix until totally incorporated. Do not over-beat. Stir in the blueberries until evenly distributed. Pour the batter into the prepared pan.
For the topping: Combine the flour, sugar, butter, cinnamon and salt in a medium bowl and cut together using 2 knives or a pastry cutter. Sprinkle over the top of the batter.
Bake until the cake is golden brown, 40 to 45 minutes. Sprinkle with sugar. Cut into squares and serve with softened butter.
ingredients: 5 tablespoons salted butter, softened, plus more for greasing the pan
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease a 9-by-13-inch baking pan with butter.
In a medium bowl, combine flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt, and stir to combine.
Set aside the flour mixture.
Cream together the butter and sugar with an electric mixer.
Add the egg and mix until combined.
Mix in the vanilla.
Alternately add the flour mixture and milk, mixing until totally incorporated. Do not over-beat.
Stir in the blueberries until evenly distributed.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan.
For the topping: Combine flour, sugar, butter, cinnamon, and salt in a medium bowl.
Cut the topping mixture together using 2 knives or a pastry cutter.
Sprinkle the topping over the batter.
Bake until the cake is golden brown, 40 to 45 minutes.
Sprinkle with sugar.
Cut into squares and serve with softened butter.

original_instructions: Whisk together the pineapple juice, soy sauce, coconut oil, ginger, honey, garlic and sesame oil in a medium bowl. Use as a marinade for pork tenderloin or chops before grilling.
step_by_step_instructions: In a medium bowl, whisk together all the ingredients: pineapple juice, soy sauce, coconut oil, ginger, honey, garlic, and sesame oil.
Use the mixture as a marinade for pork tenderloin or chops before grilling.

original_instructions:
Put the sorbet in a medium microwave-safe bowl and heat until melted. Stir in the condensed milk and let cool.
Put the cream in another medium bowl and beat with an electric mixer until it is thick and holds a ribbony shape when you run the beaters through it (do not let it form soft peaks), 2 to 3 minutes. Gently stir the thickened cream into the lemon sorbet mixture and pour into the pie crust. Smooth out into an even layer. Cover loosely with plastic wrap and freeze until set, about 2 hours or up to overnight.
step_by_step_instructions: Put the sorbet in a medium microwave-safe bowl and heat until melted.
Stir in the condensed milk and let cool.
Put the cream in another medium bowl and beat with an electric mixer until it is thick and holds a ribbony shape when you run the beaters through it.
Gently stir the thickened cream into the lemon sorbet mixture.
Pour the mixture into the pie crust.
Smooth out into an even layer.
Cover loosely with plastic wrap and freeze until set, about 2 hours or up to overnight.

original_instructions:
In a mixing bowl or standing mixer cream together the butter and sugar until light. Beat in 1 egg and mix in the molasses, orange juice, and zest. Sift together the dry ingredients and stir them into the wet ingredients to make a soft, smooth dough, adding more flour if dough is too sticky. Knead the dough three times on a lightly floured board.
Shape the dough into 3 logs, about 8-inches long, wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 1 hour or overnight.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Slice logs into thin circles, less than 1/8-inch thick. Place on lightly greased baking sheets.
Bake cookies for about 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from oven and transfer cookies to a rack to cool.
step_by_step_instructions: Cream together the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl or standing mixer until light.
Beat in 1 egg.
Mix in the molasses, orange juice, and orange zest.
Sift together the flour, baking soda, ground cloves, ground cinnamon, and ground ginger.
Stir the sifted dry ingredients into the wet ingredients to make a soft, smooth dough, adding more flour if dough is too sticky.
Knead the dough three times on a lightly floured board.
Shape the dough into 3 logs, about 8 inches long.
Wrap the logs in plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 1 hour or overnight.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Slice the logs into thin circles, less than 1/8-inch thick.
Place the slices on lightly greased baking sheets.
Bake the cookies for about 8 to 10 minutes.
Remove from the oven and transfer the cookies to a rack to cool.

original_instructions:
